title: Senior Software Engineer - ZEOS Logistics (all genders)
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfilment related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 The ZEOS Logistics department is responsible for all partner-facing Zalando Logistics Solutions. By unifying and collaborating these services under a single umbrella, we provide a more holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfilment solution to meet our partners' needs and leverage common services to enable partner program growth.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in ZEOS Logistics, you will develop and operate business-critical applications for our partners and internal stakeholders that process tens of thousands of events per second powering the critical partner-facing backend APIs and web applications of the partner fulfilment domain. You will work with tools and technologies such as Java, Kotlin, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch in building high-performance, low-latency systems to create an impact on customers and partners.
   

  

**INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN**
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion
   

  

 Our employee resource groups
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)...**
 Build and operate large-scale data streaming and processing applications serving fulfilment process relevant data with the latency of tens of milliseconds in magnitude to Zalando partners in using technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Postgres, and Elasticsearch.
   

  

 Use a state-of-the-art software development methodology.
   

  

 Be part of a newly established engineering team in Stockholm and help to foster an environment of continuous learning.
   

  

**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF..** 
 .
   

  

 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer in developing APIs and high-volume data streaming and processing systems with either Java or Kotlin.
   

  

 Initial hands-on experience with SQL storage technologies.
   

  

 Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch is in addition a plus.
   

  

 "You build it, you run it" approach you have had a first experience in managing services end-to-end, from developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support is a big plus.
   

  

 Passion for working in an agile, cross-functional team, iterating quickly during the product development cycle. As well as, ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, product managers, and engineering peers.
   

  

**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

**About Zalando**
 It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.
   

  

 Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to almost 49 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.
   

  

 Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset
   

  

 do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando
   

  

 Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Tech Lead - Platform Engineering
description:
**About Brite**
 Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.
   

  

 At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.
   

  

 Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 150 colleagues.
   

  

 Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Brite Payments, we're seeking an
 **experienced leader** 
 to drive our Platform Engineering team. In this role, you’ll lead the team in providing a platform for our engineering teams to build their products upon, and that the team operates effectively as a support and enabling function in line with Team Topologies.
   

  

****What you will do****
 As a Tech Lead for Platform Engineering, you will:
   

  

* Lead the Platform Engineering Team in its daily work in agile methodologies, solution discovery, technical implementations, deliveries, knowledge-sharing, supporting engineers, and scaling tools & practices for high adoption-rate within the department through focusing on improving the developer experience.
* Collaborate with Engineering Teams and meet their individual needs in order to enable their self-sufficiency in the full lifecycle of software development.
* Define Platform Strategy by contributing to roadmaps and architectures that balance immediate needs with long-term scalability and sustainability.
* Drive Platform Automation by improving cloud infrastructure, deployment pipelines, monitoring, and security, with a focus on minimizing operational overhead.
* Facilitate Best Practices in GCP, ensuring the team leverages tools and methodologies that maximize scalability, reliability, and security.
* Foster a Culture of Continuous Improvement by supporting teams in adopting DevOps and SRE methodologies to streamline operations and boost delivery speed.
* Mentor and Coach Team Members to foster technical growth, to maintain a supportive & collaborative engineering culture, to encourage leadership, and distribute responsibilities effectively. As a Tech Lead, you will empower team members to take on ownership of key initiatives, nurture a bottom-up approach to share the load and build cross-functional capability within your team of complementary skills and personalities.


 We have a flexible hybrid work model with an office in central Stockholm.
   

  

**Required Skills**
* Proven Leadership Experience: Demonstrated success leading both technical & cultural work in building enabling platforms and support systems for engineering teams.
* You have your competence in either cloud operations, or devops: You either come from a strong cloud operations background, or you have extensive experience from product development and modern ways of working.
* Infrastructure as Code: Proficiency with tools such as Terraform and automation frameworks for deployment and configuration management.
* Containerization & Orchestration: Hands-on experience with Docker and orchestration tools like Google Cloud Run, AWS Fargate/ECS, or similar.
* Monitoring & Logging: Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Stackdriver, Datadog) to ensure platform reliability and performance.
* CI/CD Proficiency: Excellent knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Bitbucket Pipelines, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI.
* Operational Excellence: Experience applying SRE principles, with a focus on uptime, scalability, and continuous improvement.
* Communication Skills: Strong communicator, with the ability to work effectively across teams to foster alignment and collaboration.


**Preferred Skills**
* GCP Cost Management: Experience with budgeting and optimizing cloud expenditures.
* Database Management: Knowledge of database management on GCP, including performance optimization, scalability, and security.
* Incident Management: Familiarity with incident management processes and frameworks.
* Automation Scripting: Proficiency in programming/scripting languages such as Python.
* Microservices Architecture: Strong understanding of designing and scaling microservices in a cloud environment.


 Join Brite Payments and help us empower our engineering teams to build high-quality platforms that fuel our next phase of growth. With your leadership, we’ll set the foundation for an exceptional future!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where you can be yourself.
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment, with the chance to join one of Europe’s hottest fintechs and learn from industry leaders.
* The opportunity to make an impact from day one in an organisation that values quick decision-making, teamwork, and results over titles.
* Exposure to a variety of verticals and use cases for our payments products, working with some of the fastest-growing businesses in Europe.
* An annual well-being and professional development allowance to invest in your personal growth.
* A team of fun, skilled professionals who together raised the largest Series A ($60m) in Europe last year – join colleagues who are committed to making a lasting impact. ✨


 Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

title: Senior Developer till Kleer
description:
**💛 It all comes Kleer – PE Accounting byter namn**
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad, men vi stannar inte där – vi vill mer. Vi blir Kleer!
   

  

**Vill du vara med på resan? Blir en del av vårt team som senior utvecklare!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på Kleer arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på Kleer! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida
   

  

**Vår utvecklingsmiljö:**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen som Senior Developer på Kleer:**
 Som Senior Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utveckla och förbättra vår produkt samt bidra till företagets tekniska resa framåt. Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼
   

  

* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer om Kleer som bolag:**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

*Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.*

title: UI Systems Engineer - Developer Experience (Remote)
description:
As a global leader in cybersecurity, CrowdStrike protects the people, processes and technologies that drive modern organizations. Since 2011, our mission hasn’t changed — we’re here to stop breaches, and we’ve redefined modern security with the world’s most advanced AI-native platform. We work on large scale distributed systems, processing almost 3 trillion events per day. We have 3.44 PB of RAM deployed across our fleet of C\* servers - and this traffic is growing daily. Our customers span all industries, and they count on CrowdStrike to keep their businesses running, their communities safe and their lives moving forward. We’re also a mission-driven company. We cultivate an inclusive culture that gives every CrowdStriker both the flexibility and autonomy to own their careers. We’re always looking to add talented CrowdStrikers to the team who have limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to our customers, our community and each other. Ready to join a mission that matters? The future of cybersecurity starts with you.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The CrowdStrike UI Developer Experience team (UIDX) is responsible for improving developer productivity by reducing friction through tools and processes. We currently support over 250 UI engineers who build and maintain our internal and external software products. These products are leveraged by our customers 24/7 to protect their systems from the world's most sophisticated cybersecurity adversaries.
   

  

 UIDX Provides The Systems, Infrastructure, And Tooling That Enables UI Engineers To Build, Test, Deploy, And Activate Features In Our Applications, Including
   

  

* Tools and processes for dealing with errors or incidents.
* Build processes, both local and in Continuous Integration (CI).
* Tools for troubleshooting and debugging production systems.
* Local development: setup, running, making changes to code.
* Monitoring and maintaining speed and stability of automated changes through CI pipelines.
* Enabling UI engineering teams to provide sufficient automated test coverage.
* Facilitating cross-team collaboration during development - e.g. code dependencies and shared libraries.
* Ease of deployment, activation, rollback, and deactivation of features.
* Configuration and administration of UI systems - e.g. code repositories, build pipelines, error reporting, etc.
* Documentation and training for all the above.


 As a Member Of The UIDX Team, You Will Be Part Of a Culture That Promotes a "safe Space" For Your Continued Career Growth
   

  

* We believe that a highly diverse team can solve the most challenging problems, and therefore encourage individuals to bring their whole selves to work - interests, backgrounds, demographics, joys and concerns.
* We promote and model healthy habits for work/life balance, and fully leverage paid leave judgment-free.
* We aren't afraid to have difficult conversations through a lens of understanding, and we work across teams to find solutions that are the best fit for our organization.
* We encourage our team to continuously learn and grow, through formal training and peer mentorship.
* We support each other when we struggle, we lift each other up when we win.


 If you are someone who enjoys helping engineers solve difficult problems while enabling teams to be more self-sufficient, the CrowdStrike UIDX team is the place for you!
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Provide world-class resources and service to a large and fast-growing group of UI engineers is critical to CrowdStrike's continued success. One important component of that service is to enable developers to own as much of their build as possible, and supporting developers when their builds fail. To fulfill this need, the UIDX team is looking for UI Systems Engineers of varying levels of experience who excel in one or more of these areas:
* Installation, configuration, and management of UI development systems: infrastructure, tooling, pipelines, and monitoring.
* Helping developers answer questions about the installation, configuration, and building of their apps both locally and in CI pipelines, including troubleshooting and resolving issues with builds.
* Identifying and implementing new features/documentation for local development and CI, to enable UI engineers to self-service their builds. This includes optimization of flaky and long-running builds.
* Provide training for new team members both in UIDX and UI engineering teams, to help them learn and effectively work in our systems.
* Assisting with rare or unique build scenarios, such as code freeze exceptions, rollbacks, and hotfixes for production issues.
* Participate in code reviews for new feature development (e.g. Pull Requests).


**What You'll Need**
* A good understanding of JavaScript and experience building web application user interfaces with modern frameworks such as Ember, React, Angular, or Vue.
* A good understanding of CI/CD pipeline configuration using tools such as Jenkins.
* Familiarity with client-side build processes and tools (e.g. Ember CLI, Webpack, etc.)
* Experience writing command-line scripts using Node.js.
* Experience with testing frameworks, tools and methodologies such as QUnit or Mocha.
* Familiarity with Amazon Web Services
* Comfortable with Git or similar version control systems and workflows.
* A desire to work closely with others to deliver quality software and solve problems.


**Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike**
* Remote-friendly and flexible work culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Comprehensive physical and mental wellness programs
* Competitive vacation and holidays for recharge
* Paid parental and adoption leaves
* Professional development opportunities for all employees regardless of level or role
* Employee Resource Groups, geographic neighbourhood groups and volunteer opportunities to build connections
* Vibrant office culture with world class amenities
* Great Place to Work Certified™ across the globe


 CrowdStrike is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone is valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. If you need assistance accessing or reviewing the information on this website or need help submitting an application for employment or requesting an accommodation, please contact us at recruiting@crowdstrike.com for further assistance.

title: DevOps Developer
description:
*We are looking for a curious and open-minded person who always seeks an opportunity to gain new knowledge.* 
*Do you want to contribute to our Developer’s Journey and be a part of* 
*our dedicated and ambitious team?*
**Om jobbet**
 Quality Assurance in general and Test Data Management (TDM) in particular, is a priority within Länsförsäkringar both from an efficiency and increased regulatory compliance perspective and part of our Developer’s Journey. Our dedicated and ambitious team has created the platform, based on the Delphix product, and is now on-boarding the business. It is a dynamic and interesting time to join the team! We work at the forefront both in terms of technology and working methods in the team and have a good collaboration with other teams. Our goal is to increase efficiency in the IT development process to accelerate digitalization in Länsförsäkringar.
   

  

 The work in the team is run according to Lean-Agile principles (SAFe) which means that every day starts with a Daily Stand Up. The work is divided into two-week sprints, where capabilities agreed by the team are delivered. The team consists of specialists and everyone works as a team, which may mean that you will also partially perform tasks that are outside the pure specialist role.
   

  

 In the role as DevOps Developer your focus will mainly be on developing and maintaining the routines used within the solution to:
   

  

* Collect and evaluate information from master and product systems via several different connection forms (mainly via direct database connections)
* Explore the dataset in SQL/Python/custom command-line interfaces to normalize and model acquired data
* Develop and maintain the procedures used to anonymize the information and then make it available to test environments
* Work with cross-functional agile teams to provide test data automatically to support CI/CD pipeline in various test environments
* Ensure the quality and integrity of the data handled
* Monitor and resolve any issues in the data flows that are created


 Administer and maintain regular data lifecycle events such as user administration, auditing, log management, etc.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 We think you have:
   

  

* At least 5 years in software development
* Good knowledge of Windows-based environments
* Good knowledge of Linux-based environments
* At least two years of development experience in Java, Python and SQL
* At least two years of experience in agile work
* Good experience with Git or similar tools
* Experience in data-driven development
* Good experience of working with large amounts of information
* Experience with Shell scripts / Powershell scripts
* Fluency in English


 It would also be beneficial if you have:
   

  

* Strong understanding of databases
* Previous experience of working with TDM, preferably with Delphix as a base
* Experience of development in environments with high demands on security and data protection
* Previous experience from large and complex DB2 solutions
* Understanding of file systems and operating systems
* Knowledge of data integrity and masking techniques
* Basic knowledge of virtualization
* Experience of imparting knowledge to others
* Experience with Azure DevOps Server
* Fluency in Swedish


 We are looking for a team-player and we believe you’re a curious and open-minded person who always seeks an opportunity to gain new knowledge, meanwhile having a strong self-leadership in your work.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Our group Effektiv systemutveckling, ESU, consists of about 30 employees, including Product Owners, DevOps Engineers and Lean agile Coach. Regardless of role, we all work towards the same goals to enable high digital quality and effective IT development within the company, ensuring both satisfied employees and customers. Group manager Charlotta Haldin:
 *As a leader, I focus on creating the right conditions and I trust my teams to always do their best. I believe in openness and the individual's ability to perform and deliver value together with others. I believe in constant learning and know that innovation requires courage and failure.* 
 As a group we are engaged, proud of our performance and we have fun together.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-08**
 The recruitment process will take a short break during the summer and we will get back to you regarding your application in August. Thank you for your patience and we wish you a nice summer!

description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:** 



* Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
* Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
* Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
* Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
* Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
* Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
* Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: iOS Developer • Business Experience
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we are seeking a creative iOS Developer to join one of our teams at the forefront of shaping innovative solutions and crafting modern digital products that positively impact people's lives across our organization. If this introduction sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**What You Need To Know About The Role**
 This is an exciting opportunity to work on tackling exciting technical challenges together with talented peers in a cross-functional agile team. You will create modern digital products that affect people’s lives for the better within PayPal globally.
   

  

**Meet our team**
 We are the Orders team, dedicated to creating exceptional payment experiences for both our users and their customers, serving millions globally. As an Agile team, we focus on delivering small, high-quality increments regularly to provide continuous value to our customers. We foster a welcoming environment for new team members and are committed to supporting your learning journey in ways that work best for you.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with skilled and highly motivated engineers specializing in backend, iOS, Android, and quality assurance to deliver a world-class experience for our users. You'll benefit from their extensive delivery experience, accelerating your learning journey and enabling you to contribute to exciting features and improvements in the Payment and Orders Experience areas, serving customers at scale across multiple geolocations.
   

  

**Your day to day**
* You will help to deliver high quality solutions to our users.
* You will work as part of an agile team, planning, refining, delivering and inspecting sprint deliveries.
* You work closely with product and design to understand context and vision.
* You will learn and work with your peers in the iOS chapter to make incremental platform improvements and increase learning opportunities for all in a supportive environment.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Good experience in iOS development, with good knowledge of Swift.
* Familiarity with iOS SDK and various Apple's frameworks and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing.
* Keen interest in keeping up to date with the latest technological development.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


**We Believe in You**
 Ready to tell us more about yourself? Feel free to apply
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

title: Senior Asset Manager Sweden
description:
The Company is now looking for a well experienced Senior Asset Manager Sweden to join their professional team in Stockholm.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Senior Asset Manager, you will participate in the growing Asset Management team in the European market with focus on Sweden. The Senior Asset Manager will be responsible of managing the assets of various funds with different investors and return/risk profiles. The company is planning to build and acquire more assets in the Nordics, particularly in Sweden. The number of assets and the locations in Sweden, the Asset Manager will be responsible for, may therefore vary over time. The position is based in Stockholm and the role will require travelling to the assets on a regular basis to meet the tenants, property- and facility managers or valuers for e.g. The Senior Asset Manager Sweden will report to Group Head of Asset Management.
 



  





**About The company** 




 The Asset Management team, comprising five people in UK, Germany, Denmark and Sweden seeks to identify core, core plus and value-add real estate investment opportunities that allow to unlock underlying asset-specific value in Sweden with promising rental growth outlook. The focus is on logistics and industrial assets in gateway cities with strong demographics and optimal traffic infrastructure.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities and Tasks** 



* The Asset Manager will be a key member of the Swedish team. The person will work in a small dedicated team and will gain lots of responsibility from day one.
* The Asset Manager is looking after a newly developed and acquired logistics portfolio in Sweden to drive expansion in this country in terms of commercial asset management.
* The Asset Manager will be expected to contribute to long-term value creation with a highly strategic and creative approach.
* Building and maintaining relationships with owners, existing and potential tenants and external service providers such as real estate brokers, property managers, facility managers and municipalities is important for the success.
* The person is in charge of lease negotiations with the tenants (new leasing, lease renewals and rent reviews) and the first point of contact as landlord`s representative.
* The Asset Manager will be responsible for the negotiation of all property management contracts with a strong focus on the commercial aspects of the agreement and will also oversee the appointment of external property managers.
* The candidate will work closely with third parties to provide direction for and oversight of property management, business plans, budgets & service charges, forecasts, leases, analysis and approvals.
* The person will be able to contribute during the investment/divestment process of DD in connection with new acquisitions and sales (review of asset operational assumptions for e.g.).
* The person will be involved in the preparation and distribution of regular asset management reports to investors, advisors and other partners.
* The Senior Asset Manager will work with colleagues to create an annual business plan for each asset and monitor variances throughout the year.
* Implementing policies to drive cash flow through changing the tenant mix, carrying out capital work projects, driving the leasing agents, dealing with lawyers. Budgeting for yielding assets and developments is also part of this role.
* The candidate will prepare data for updating building insurance or takes out new building insurance with an external service provider.



  





**Qualification and suitable background** 



* A good first degree including a Bachelor degree in real estate, finance or business administration is preferred.
* At least 5 years’ experience from the Logistics Real Estate Market in Sweden and knowledge about relevant aspects of the day to day asset management and for budgeting and reporting purposes. In addition, leasing experience in Sweden and in-depth knowledge of the market and its submarkets.
* Experience of working in an European environment and in more than one country is a plus
* MS Excel skills, ability to review analysis, total and relative returns etc.
* Solid understanding of asset and portfolio specific reporting.
* Communication skills in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
* High personal drive a willingness to deliver high quality, being committed and dedicated. Great interpersonal skills, team player and ambitious.
* Professional attitude, high work ethics and energy level, proactive style and ability to work under pressure and getting things done both independently as well as in teams.



  





**Your Application** 




 Sounds interesting? Please apply for the position at www.boardtalk.se. For further questions, contact Jonna Holmqvist at Boardtalk +46 70 790 08 93 or jonna.holmqvist@boardtalk.se or Johan Magnusson at Boardtalk +46 72 248 65 31 or johan.magnusson@boardtalk.se. Interviews will be conducted continuously. Welcome!
 



  





**About the Company** 




 The company is a developer, real estate investor, asset and investment manager, specializing in the industrial and logistics sector and operating across Europe and Sweden.
 



  





 The company’s current development pipeline is more than 1.1 million sqm with a focus on technology and innovation. The company’s new-build projects are designed with the aim of achieving a high level of green building certification such as DGNB Gold, BREEAM Very Good or LEED Gold accreditation.
 



  





**About Boardtalk** 




 Boardtalk helps people grow and companies develop by offering a niche service within search, recruitment and interim. Especially for the real estate and finance sector.
 



  





 For more information about Boardtalk, visit www.boardtalk.se

title: DevSecOps Product Owner
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 CloudRAN PEU EE&S pipeline services team leads the way in providing the best developer experience and making continuous delivery of Cloud RAN value to customers possible. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevSecOps Product Owner to lead the development and implementation of secure software delivery practices within our organization. The ideal candidate will drive the vision, strategy, and execution of DevSecOps initiatives, working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that security is integrated into every stage of the software development lifecycle.
   

  

 The pipeline services team is intended for developing, maintaining, and supporting CI/CD infrastructure, CI/CD flows, data visualization, and security to support the development of cloud-native applications which are built using container technology and orchestrated using Kubernetes. This new development methodology aligns Ericsson with the industry direction, enabling faster time to market through instant reuse, and collaboration and providing an opportunity for early alignment across Ericsson applications.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Product Owner to be part of a state-of-the-art pipeline service. We are organized in a cross-functional multi-domain and globally distributed team in which we foster continuous improvement, innovation, and knowledge sharing. Your mission as a PO is to streamline the day-to-day work by owning the prioritized backlog aligning with various stakeholders and representing the team at various forums. Main interfaces: Strategic Product Managers, System Architects, DevOps Teams & Line Management, Scrum Masters, and Customers.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

* Agile team member, primarily responsible for improving the value delivered by the team by ensuring that the team backlog is aligned with customer and stakeholder needs.
* Collaborates closely with Product Management on the product vision and strategy.
* Handles functional and non-functional requirements.
* Maintains and prioritizes the team backlog.
* Leads the team backlog refinement, iteration planning (with the support of stream leads), and elaboration of user stories.
* Ensures the team delivers the features in the Release Plan on time and within budget.
* Defines the service scope and Service Level Agreement (SLA) with our suppliers.
* Understands and optimizes the product’s Total Cost of Ownership (TCO).
* Creates and maintains product information (PPM, IT Service Catalog, PRIM, system documentation, release notes and end-user documentation).
* Secures visibility with proper communication, and keeps contact with the stakeholders and users.
* Contributes to a collaborative and stimulating work environment.


 Join our Team
   

  

 You will bring
   

  

* Education: University degree in Engineering or Computer Science, or similar relevant field.
* Minimum years of experience: 5 years working as a Product Owner (knowledge of Product Management and Product Development Lifecycle).
* In-depth knowledge of Agile processes and principles.
* Strong customer/stakeholder engagement skills and team management.
* Consistent track record of working effectively in team environments by demonstrating the ability to collaborate with colleagues to achieve goals and deliver quality results.
* Outstanding communication, presentation, and leadership skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Good understanding of budget planning, resource planning and delivery execution.
* Experience in one or more of the following is an asset: Cloud Infrastructure, SaaS, Security & Privacy, DevOps, and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning.


 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Why join Ericsson?
   

  

 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: IT RISK AND COMPLIANCE MANAGER
description:
**IT Risk and Compliance Manager**
 We believe in security by design and privacy by design and enabling our teams to proactively work with risk management and cybersecurity. The IT Risk and Compliance Manager will work on the areas of Governance, Risk & Compliance to ensure cyber security and data protection across SAS operations. In this role, you will be responsible for IT risk management including vendor risk management, data privacy policies and standards, governing risk management and data privacy processes, and ensuring compliance to these. You are directly reporting to the Head of IT Ops and SecOps, and you are a vital part of the SAS Cybersecurity Skill Hub.
   

  

**As IT Risk and Compliance Manager, your main responsibilities are to:**
* Work together with the different teams within Digital and IT to enable the teams to work more hands-on with risk management and cybersecurity
* Develop and enhance cyber and data security policies, control objectives, controls, risk management processes and standards aligned with information security regulations, best practices, and frameworks
* Oversee and drive the cyber risk management processes, incl. cybersecurity controls follow-up and vendor risk management across SAS
* Align key stakeholders on cybersecurity policies, data privacy, guide and enable cybersecurity and data privacy practices across the organization
* Assist with internal and 3rd party audits and address associated findings, such as EASA, IOSA and PCI-DSS
* Own, develop and be system administrator of our IT risk and privacy management system OneTrust


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have**
* A Degree in Information Security, Privacy Management, Information Systems or Computer Science is preferred or commensurate relevant work experience
* Minimum of 5 years’ experience with focus on regulatory compliance and involvement in either data privacy management or cybersecurity management
* In-depth knowledge and understanding of global privacy legislation (e.g., GDPR)
* Knowledge and experience of cyber security standards. Specific knowledge of NIST Cyber Security Framework seen as an advantage
* Experience in translating privacy and/or security regulations into workable and implementable policies and processes
* Experience in implementing enterprise IT risk and privacy management systems, experinece from OneTrust seen as an advantage
* Fluent in English, Swedish or other Nordic languages considered as an advantage
* Experience from aviation, e-commerce and/or from large enterprises seen as an advantage
* Experience from working in a developer intense organization close to development teams seen as an advantage


**Personal Qualifications**
* Professional with a positive attitude and capable of contributing to a dynamic and team-oriented culture
* Strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively and build consensus with teams across organizational lines


 If you feel inspired by the position and feel this is the right challenge for your career, we are looking forward to receiving your application and CV!
   

  

 SAS, Scandinavia's leading airline since 1946, operates from its principal hub at Copenhagen Airport (CPH), complemented by hubs in Oslo (OSL) and Stockholm (ARN).
   

  

 Our mission is to connect Scandinavia with the world and the world with Scandinavia. Each year, SAS serves more than 25 million passengers and transports 55 tons of cargo to 135 destinations across Europe, the USA, and Asia. With a passionate workforce of over 10,000 colleagues, we collaborate with partners and customers to drive transformative changes in aviation. We are committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, embodying the visionary spirit of our founders: “To move from the old to what is about to come, is the only tradition worth keeping”. Innovation and societal progress are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 For more information, visit our website at www.flysas.com or follow us on social media for the latest updates and promotions.

title: Change Driver to Financial Crime Prevention
description:
**Job ID: 28022** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Business Developer for Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP) to own our internal change agenda and internal communication plan.
 







  
 







 As the Business Developer you play a key role in ensuring that all employees in GFCP understand the GFCP vision, strategy and goals, and how to execute them. Together with the leadership team, you define the right actions to ensure progress along the change journey we are making in GFCP, with a special focus on activities that enhance engagement and motivation.  
 







  
 







 By managing and executing change projects and communication activities, you deliver high-quality content to our organisation and advise our leadership team on change management and communication matters. You contribute to growing GFCP employee engagement by embedding effective two-way communication, supporting leaders in their communication and help them find ways to increase engagement and dedication to the development and implementation of the GFCP strategy.
 





  

  



 This is an opportunity for you to join and grow together with us in GFCP, an organization that is fully engaged in the mission to protect Nordea, its customers and society at large.
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 








  
 







 Welcome to GFCP!  
 







  
 







**What you will be doing:** 





* Own GFCP’s internal change and communication plan in close collaboration with the GFCP leadership team. Define key messages and develop content that effectively translates our vision and strategy to our people
* Represent GFCP in relevant communication forums to ensure activities are supporting the GFCP strategy and follow up on planned deliveries in close cooperation with the Communication Business Partner
* Plan and manage our leadership communication Plan and host relevant meetings,  ensuring that content and messaging are relevant, clear, and aligned to our strategy and culture. Support and advise the Head of GFCP  on communication matters, such as messaging, Q&As, presentations etc.
* Serve as GFCP Intra site coordinator, creating intranet articles, surveys and resource repository. Ensure that Intra content is of high quality
* Strengthen employee engagement and two-way communication in GFCP together with relevant stakeholders. Plan activities and content that creates engagement and motivation for our employees. Manage internal community content including forums, Yammer channels, and user-generated content that inspires
* Ensure communication is consistent, high quality and relevant to key stakeholders
* Follow external communication in the market and ensure relevant knowledge sharing on your findings with the organization





  
 







 You’ll join our Business Support team, reporting to Hans Annuk. The role is based in Tallinn, Helsinki, Stockholm or Poland.
 







  
 







**Who you are** 








  
 







 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 







  
 







**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are curious by nature, eager to find out more and connect relevant dots
* Have strong stakeholder management skills
* You can drive and lead change projects and initiatives
* Are a natural and confident relationship builder with high integrity and proficiency building a communication strategy across diverse communication media
* Are able to work with data and insights in a structured way. Transform data into insights and recommended actions
* Are an excellent storyteller who loves to find ways to translate business strategy and plans into engaging messages and communication
* Understand the role and importance of change and communication in successfully implementing strategy
* Have an educator’s mindset, intuitively understanding what the audience needs to know and how they want to consume it
* Have solid experience of content creation; producing articles, speeches, presentations etc.
* Have strong writing, editing and proofreading skills, with attention to detail
* Are a structured and efficient doer, always delivering with high quality in a timely manner
* Have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 26/01/2025
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Hans Kristjaan Annuk, hans.kristjaan.annuk@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Wordpress-Utvecklare
description:
**Nu söker vi på Treat:Oh efter en Wordpress-utvecklare med rätt till ägarandel** 




  





**Om oss:** 




  





 Treat:Oh är en modern och innovativ plattform för skönhetsbranschen, skapad för att förenkla bokningar och möta både behandlares och kunders behov. Vi erbjuder en lösning som kopplar samman privatpersoner och företag inom skönhetssektorn, med fokus på användarvänlighet och tillgänglighet via både webb och mobilapp. Nu är vi redo att ta nästa steg i vår resa och söker en passionerad utvecklare som vill vara en del av denna tillväxtresa.
 



  





**Om rollen:** 




  





 Vi söker en
 **Wordpress-utvecklare** 
 som är redo att sätta sin prägel på vår plattform och hjälpa oss ta den till nästa nivå. Rollen innebär att vidareutveckla vår webbplats och applikation för att förbättra funktionalitet, användarupplevelse och skalbarhet. Detta är en unik möjlighet för dig som vill engagera dig långsiktigt och vara en del av något större.
 



 Då detta är en strategisk roll, erbjuder vi ingen traditionell ersättning. Istället får du möjlighet att bli en delägare i företaget och dela framgången med oss.
 



  





**Vad vi söker:** 




  




* Expertkunskaper i
 **Wordpress** 
 och relaterade teknologier (t.ex. PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och optimera responsiva webbplatser och applikationer.
* Förmåga att integrera och anpassa tredjepartsplugin samt utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar.
* Kreativitet och problemlösningsförmåga för att implementera nya funktioner och förbättringar.
* Stark förståelse för UX/UI-design och hur man skapar användarvänliga gränssnitt.
* Erfarenhet av versionshantering (t.ex. Git) och moderna arbetsflöden är meriterande.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 



* Möjlighet att bli en delägare i Treat:Oh och få en aktiv roll i företagets framgång.
* Frihet att påverka tekniska beslut och lösningar.
* En spännande och dynamisk miljö där din insats gör verklig skillnad.
* Chansen att vara med och forma en växande plattform med stor potential.



  





**Är detta du?:** 




  





 Om du känner att du har rätt kompetens och driv för att hjälpa Treat:Oh växa, skicka din ansökan med en kort beskrivning av dig själv och tidigare projekt.
 



  





*Tillsammans tar vi skönhetsbranschen nästa nivå!*

title: Accigos konsultprogram HT25 – Utveckling CRM & Power Platform
description:
*Har du nyligen tagit examen? Har du intresse för IT, digitalisering och utveckling?
   

  

 Då erbjuder vi en unik möjlighet att kickstarta din tech-karriär hos oss!*
 Hos oss kommer du bli en fullfjädrad utvecklare och få planera och leverera i agila utvecklingsprojekt hos våra kunder. Rollen innebär effektivisering av processer med hjälp av Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM), low code i Power Platform och utveckling i våra primära språk .NET och JavaScript.
   

  

 Vi bygger CRM-lösningar som stödjer antingen våra kunders sälj- eller ärendehanteringsprocesser, men också helt kundunika lösningar. Integrationer är vanligt förekommande i de flesta projekten. Hos oss är spektrat brett och det vi i teamet alla har gemensamt är ett i grunden tekniskt intresse såväl som en förståelse för våra kunders verksamhetsprocesser.
   

  

 Accigos konsultprogram går man tillsammans med nya konsulter från olika team. Under konsultprogrammet får du lära dig Accigos affärer, verktyg, ramverk och kultur. På så vis får du förutsättningar att bli en framgångsrik, konsultmässig konsult med projektförståelse och grunderna i ways of working i Accigo-leveranser.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om konsultprogrammet här samt mer om Accigo här.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* Nyligen tagit examen från universitetet/högskola (systemvetare/civilingenjör eller motsvarande) eller arbetat max två år inom tech efter avslutad examen
* Har ett stort intresse för teknik och utveckling (JavaScript och .Net)
* Tycker om att samarbeta med såväl kunder som kollegor
* Pratar och skriver svenska obehindrat


 Du är en person som är initiativtagande med positiv energi, och gillar att samarbeta med andra. För att trivas på Accigo är det viktigt att du är kommunikativ, nyfiken och prestigelös.
   

  

 Team Customer Engagement (CRM) & Power Platform
   

  

 Vi har ett stort hjärta för varandra och det vi gör. I det dagliga arbetet antar vi roller som lösningsarkitekt, systemutvecklare, applikationskonsult och projektledare. Inom teamet finns erfarenhet från flera branscher och alltifrån små lösningar med ett fåtal användare till stora komplexa lösningar med hundratals användare. Vi ser alltid till att kombinera vår tekniska expertis med en hög grad av verksamhetsförståelse och förändringsledning, för att lyckas behöver vi sätta användarens vardag i fokus.
   

  

 För oss stärker det vi-känslan och säkrar både en bra leverans gentemot kunden samt glädje och balans i vardagen för oss i teamet. Vi värdesätter humor, lyhördhet och glädje och är övertygade att en kram eller ett gott skratt förlänger livet!
   

  

**Nyfiken?** 
 Vi svarar gärna på frågor, du kan enkelt komma i kontakt med oss: amir.hosseini@accigo.se
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen
   

  

 Processen ser ut som följer: 1) Ansökan 2) logik- och personlighetstester, 3) digital intervju, 4) case och intervju på vårt kontor, 5) kontraktsgenomgång.
   

  

 Case och intervju på vårt kontor kommer att ske antingen 18/2 eller 19/2, boka in dessa två dagar i din kalender redan nu.
   

  

 Ansökningsperioden stänger
 **fredag den 31/1** 
 och rekryteringsprocessen beräknas avslutas tredje veckan av februari. Urval och återkoppling sker senast en vecka efter ansökningsperioden. Konsultprogrammet startar i augusti 2025.
   

  

**OBS:** 
 Du kan endast ansöka till en annons inom Accigos konsultprogram och kommer inte ha större chans att gå vidare i processen genom att söka flera tjänster. Har du svårt att välja vilken annons som passar dig bäst? Du är varmt välkommen att höra av dig.
   

  

 Ta chansen och boosta din karriär, sök tjänsten idag!
   

  

 Accigo är ett nordiskt konsultbolag som hjälper företag och organisationer med digital affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling med tekniken som möjliggörare. För oss handlar digitalisering till 90% om människor och 10% om teknik. Det är när samspelet mellan människa och teknik fungerar som digitaliseringens fulla styrka visar sig.
   

  

 För många handlar digitalisering mest om teknik. För oss är det så otroligt mycket större. Digitalisering kan få både människor och organisationer att våga sikta högre, följa sina drömmar och öppna dörrar som de inte ens visste fanns. Och när man ser igenom tekniken och börjar skönja vilka möjligheter som gömmer sig där bakom. Då ser man att framtiden kan vara en fantastisk plats – fylld av mänsklig energi och värme – och digitalisering är inget annat än vår superkraft för att komma dit.

title: Testare
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du redo för en större uppgift? Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag – att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 IT-avdelningens främsta uppgift är att tillhandahålla IT-tjänster till hela Polismyndigheten. IT-avdelningen är en viktig del av det brottsförebyggande och brottsbekämpande arbetet och IT är ett av de viktigaste verktygen för att effektivisera polisen och öka kvaliteten i polisarbetet. IT-avdelningen utvecklar och moderniserar polisens IT och myndigheten satsar mycket på att stärka avdelningen med ny specialistkompetens och den senaste teknologin till nytta för medborgarna och medarbetarna i den polisiära verksamheten.
   

  

 Operativa verksamhetssystem ansvarar för att tillhandahålla IT-stöd för operativ verksamhet, i huvudsak för poliser i yttre tjänst. Resursplaneringsgruppen, där vi söker testare, ansvarar för ett egenutvecklat IT-stöd, COPS (Centralt operativt planeringsstöd), polisens systemstöd för operativ personal- och insatsplanering.
   

  

 Till vårt team söker vi nu en testare med placeringsort i Stockholm.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som testare, med fokus på manuella tester, jobbar du nära våra utvecklare. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar att planera testarbetet tillsammans med testledaren, delta i manuella testarbetet, skriva testfall samt administrera systemets testmiljöer tillsammans med teamet.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Tester av nyutvecklade funktioner
* Tester av rättade buggar
* Felsökning
* Regressionstester vid större uppgraderingar
* Delta på förvaltningsmöten mm med våra användare


 Vi jobbar agilt och hanterar såväl livscykelhantering som vidareutveckling och test inom gruppen.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* Högskole- eller yrkesutbildning inom IT eller kunskap förvärvad på annat sätt, som av arbetsgivaren bedöms likvärdig
* 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med tester
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av komplexa it-stöd för resursplanering
* Erfarenhet av att granska kravdokumentation för att säkerställa att kraven är mät- och testbara
* Erfarenhet av testverktyg som UFT / Selenium
* Erfarenhet av arbete med automatiska tester


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som är engagerad och strukturerad, med ett starkt inre driv. Du har förmågan att kunna ta ansvar för komplexa arbetsuppgifter på ett självständigt sätt, samtidigt som du är en lagspelare som tycker om att arbeta tillsammans med andra mot gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Rollen innebär många kontaktytor, vilket kräver god förmåga att samarbeta och bygga relationer med andra samt god kommunikativ förmåga.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef: Ann-Charlotte Vikesdal, Gruppchef, 010-56 34853/070-2361009, ann-charlotte.vikesdal@polisen.se
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult: Emelie Fredriksson, emelie-a.fredriksson@polisen.se
   

  

*Vi vill informera dig om att vår tillgänglighet är begränsad under jul- och nyårshelgerna mellan 23 december 2024 och 6 januari 2025. Under denna period kan det ta lite längre tid för oss att svara på frågor gällande processen. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och ser fram emot att återkoppla till dig så snart som möjligt efter högtiderna.*
 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn: 010-563 87 10
   

  

 SACO, nås via Polisens växel 114 14
   

  

 SEKO Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn: 010-561 66 27
   

  

 ST, nås via Polisens växel 114 14
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Anställningsbenämning: Handläggare
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Dagtid med flex
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Testare
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 Besvara följande urvalsfrågor (pdf, 249 kB)som en del av din ansökan. Spara ner enkäten, besvara frågorna och bifoga den i mejlet med din ansökan/CV.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och enkät via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se senast den
 **8 januari 2025.** 
 Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer** 
**A745.589/2024** 
**i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

**Polismyndigheten**
*Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på* 
*https://polisen.se/erbjudande*
*Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.*
*Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se*
*www.polisen.se*
**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansök via e-post

title: BA / utvecklare ServiceNow
description:
Vi på Centric söker en driven och engagerad Business Analyst eller utvecklare som vill bidra till vidareutvecklingen av vår kunds ServiceNow-plattform. Plattformen är en central del av deras verksamhet och används av över 20 000 medarbetare.
 



  





 Du kommer att bli en del av förvaltningsorganisationen i Stockholm, som är indelad i team baserade på olika produktområden. Här samarbetar utvecklare, Business Analysts, UX-designers, Service Managers och Service Owners för att ständigt förbättra och utveckla plattformen. Om du brinner för att skapa effektiva och användarvänliga lösningar är detta en spännande möjlighet att vara med och påverka i en dynamisk och teamorienterad miljö.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Business Analyst kommer du att möta komplexa utmaningar och arbeta nära tillsammans med kollegor och kunder för att bidra till kundens utveckling. I en agil arbetsmiljö är det viktigt att du trivs med att ta egna initiativ, har en hjälpsam inställning och en stark servicekänsla.
 



 Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar att skapa och förvalta Business Rules, Client Scripts, Script Includes, ACL:er och integrationer, samt att utveckla flöden inom olika delar av ServiceNow-plattformen. Rollen innebär också att analysera krav och översätta dem till tekniska specifikationer, samtidigt som du deltar i workshops och dialoger med verksamheten eller kunder för att säkerställa att lösningarna möter deras behov.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




  





*Vi söker dig som har:* 



* En relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ServiceNow-utveckling
* Goda kunskaper i Javascript
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och automatisera processer och flöden i ServiceNow
* Vana vid att hålla workshops och föra dialoger med kunder eller verksamheter
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning, felsökning och hantering av incidenter



  





*Meriterande erfarenheter:* 



* Erfarenhet av On-prem/Self-hosted-lösningar
* Genomförda uppgraderingar av ServiceNow
* Implementering av ServiceNow eller dess moduler
* Kunskap om verktyg som Camunda, Docusign, Blue Prism eller andra lösningar för automatisering av processer



  





 Den här rollen passar dig som har en kombination av teknisk kompetens och förmågan att bygga goda samarbeten i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö.
 



  





 Relevanta certifieringar kan också vara positivt. (exempelvis: Certified System Administrator (CSA), Certified System Administrator (CSA), Certified Application Developer (CAD), Certified Implementation Specialist, Human Resources (CIS HR), Certified Implementation Specialist , TSM (CIS ITSM)
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Vi hjälper dig att nå dina personliga mål. Vi tycker nämligen att alla våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas, oavsett om de är juniorer eller har några år på nacken. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Och inte nog med det – du som konsult får även lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan utifrån dina speciella intresseområden, där vi tar notan för både studiematerial och certifieringar. Hos oss på Centric kommer du snabbt in i gemenskapen genom våra interna och externa aktiviteter där vi träffas och hittar på något roligt tillsammans.
 



  





 Centric är ett IT-företag med ca 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: ServiceNow developer
description:
Arbetar du som ServiceNow utvecklare idag? Vill du arbeta i en organisation där du tillsammans med kunniga och utvecklingsinriktade kollegor får möjlighet att driva en av Sveriges största it-miljöer framåt? Hos oss får du intressanta arbetsuppgifter i samhällets hjärta, kombinerat med utvecklingsmöjligheter och balans mellan arbete och fritid. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverkets it-avdelning ansvarar för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av myndighetens it-system. Skatteverket levererar idag it-drift till flera kunder. Vi arbetar för att vara Sveriges bästa it-driftleverantör för myndigheter och inom ServiceNow sker flera intressanta samarbeten med andra myndigheter. Tillsammans med kunniga och nytänkande kollegor kommer du bidra till Skatteverkets uppdrag att skapa samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Skatteverket går nu in i en ny fas av uppbyggnad och innovation då vi kommer att leverera it-tjänster och it- drift till fler statliga myndigheter. Därför skalar vi upp och stärker våra team med nya medarbetare som vill jobba med leverans av dessa tjänster till Sveriges myndigheter.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ditt team arbetar ni i nära samverkan med verksamheten, konfigurerar och utvecklar i ServiceNow-plattformen. Fokus framåt är att fortsätta utveckla och förbättra våra interna processer men också att hitta nya områden för att förenkla och automatisera vardagen genom ServiceNow-plattformen. Vi siktar högt och når goda resultat och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha balans mellan arbete och fritid
   

  

 I rollen som utvecklare kommer du att fortsatt utveckla vår ServiceNow plattform. Skatteverket använder idag bland annat modulerna ITSM, ITOM, HRSD, Discovery, CMDB och Service Catalog samt flera egenutvecklade moduler. Vi söker nu utvecklare som vill växa inom flera av dessa områden men med en gedigen bas inom ITSM modulen. I rollen arbetar du även med externa integrationer som använder moderna webbteknologier och utför system- och integrationstest.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling genom exempelvis innovationssprintar. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och som du regelbundet kommer arbeta med i form av både par- och mobbprogrammering där du kan utvecklas i både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och ett friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara resultatinriktad och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och kunna ställa om vid förändringar
* ha god kommunikationsförmåga och lätt för att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* för tjänsten relevant utbildning eller flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av systemutveckling i ServiceNow.
