I rollen ingår även att förse strategisk rådgivning och ledning inom ServiceNow-plattformen. Du kommer även vara drivande i att optimera användandet av ServiceNow-plattformen genom att proaktivt driva färdplanen i riktningen för att implementera tekniska och kostnadseffektiva lösningar. Du leder även utvecklingsprojekt inom ServiceNow-plattformen från koncept till leverans.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling genom exempelvis innovationssprintar. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och ett friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och kunna ställa om vid förändringar
* ha förmågan och viljan att dela med dig av dina kunskaper och föra kunskapen vidare
* ha god kommunikationsförmåga och lätt för att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska
* ha en god förmåga att på ett enkelt sätt förklara komplex teknik och struktur till icke-insatta.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* för tjänsten relevant utbildning eller flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som aktuell och relevant
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att ha arbeta med arkitektur i ServiceNow
* erfarenhet av styrningsprocesser (governance)
* erfarenhet av att stötta och vägleda produktägare med riktlinjer och standarder.


 Det är önskvärt om du innehar relevanta certifieringar så som: ITIL, CSA och en eller flera CIS certifieringar. Relevant erfarenhet av flerkundslösning i plattformen samt licensoptimering av ServiceNow är även det önskvärt.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg, Göteborg eller Malmö | Län: Ospecificerad arbetsort | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/479 | Kontakt: Caroline Törnkvist (HR-specialist rekrytering) caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, Peter Nordström (Rekryterande chef) peter.nordstrom@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-18 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-15

title: Head of Information Security
description:
We are super excited to announce that our CIO Magnus Ahlberg is now looking to welcome our next Head of Information Security. In this role, you’ll be the forefront of safeguarding our company and raising awareness of risk management while enabling innovation and growth.
   

  

**About The Role And Day-to-day**
 As the Head of Information Security you will lead and drive the security strategy, ensuring that our teams are empowered to deliver secure, cutting-edge solutions with streamlined processes. An essential part will be to coach the organization in security related topics, setting up processes to enable continuously improvement to mitigate the level of risk to the organization. This includes:
   

  

* Leading the company's information security strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and fostering a security-conscious culture.
* Driving the ISO 27001 certification project to completion, including risk management, process rollout, and compliance with key security frameworks.
* Establishing secure software development practices, including product risk management, vulnerability management, and security architecture.
* Serving as the subject matter expert and advisor for internal stakeholders, promoting security awareness and best practices company-wide.


**So who are you?**
 We believe you have a solid background of success in dynamic fast-growing international businesses. You excel at driving change by engaging and inspiring to adopt secure practices through clear communication and leadership. With excellent relationships skills with internal and external stakeholders you are serving as the go-to person for security related initiatives and questions. After all, security is about creating solutions that empower everyone, right?
   

  

 In addition to your personal attributes, you probably have:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in working with information security
* Experience implementing or maintaining ISO 27001 certification and/or SOC2 compliance in a tech company
* Knowledge of secure development practices within software development
* Knowledge in the area of data privacy legislation, mainly GDPR and best practices for technical and organizational security from a legal perspective


**What's in it for you?**
 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Staff Product Designer, Central Team
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a
 **Staff Product Designer** 
 to join our Central Team. The
 **Central team** 
 focuses on providing one north star experience to all our customers at Wolt. You'll be collaborating closely with research, motion, content design, as well as the design system and operation team.
   

  

 This will be someone who has mastered the craft of turning insights into beautifully designed products, who can inspire organisations through prototyping and storytelling to ensure their final work has maximum impact for the customer.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
**You’re a great fit for this role if you:**
* Drive strategic initiatives and shape broad direction of design
* Operate as a thought leader, communicating and advocating for design decisions across teams and with senior stakeholders, often influencing company-wide decisions
* Handle highly ambiguous and complex problems that require broader perspective, cross functional collaboration, and long term thinking
* Design end to end, crafting visually delightful experiences
* Thrive in a fast-paced organisation
* Are curious about new AI technologies and how we can use them in design


**What you’ll do:**
* Listen carefully. The better you understand our users problems the better your solutions will be. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people and not just the loudest voice in the room.
* Collaborate across teams. You’ll partner closely with product, engineering, and business folks to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges. You’ll provide the thought leadership to inspire and develop the right design direction. Together, you’ll solve problems and come up with solutions that delight our users.
* Imagine the way forward. You’ll take full ownership of your work, and be responsible for every last detail, every step of the way.


**Who you are:**
* Experience. You’ve been designing for 10+ years (app and desktop) for a consumer-focused tech company , so understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* Mastery. You are a versatile t-shaped designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design—to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the user.
* You’re a strong communicator. You can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* You have a people-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.


**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt! Please kindly make sure to include your portfolio with your application.
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 27 countries today, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

*Wolt not only offers great apps to customers and partners, but is also developing a broad range of technologies and solutions. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of minutes, in the customer’s own language.*
***So, why work at Wolt?***
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
*You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people. We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*
*The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.*
***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion***
*We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*
*Join us today to build Wolt together.*

title: Data Protection & Compliance Officer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Compliance Function
 

 Trustly Group AB’s second line of defense consists of the Compliance Function, Risk Function and the Chief Information Security Officer. The position is within the Compliance team which consists of three Compliance Officers excluding the position now being hired. The Function is led by the Chief Compliance Officer which gives the function a total of five FTE’s.
 








**About
 **the role
 

 We are looking for a Data Protection Officer / Compliance Officer to join our Compliance team in Trustly Group AB. As a DPO / CO you will report to Trustly’s Chief Compliance Officer and be based in the Stockholm office. Your day-to-day work will include normal DPO and compliance tasks such as advice and support, performing controls, hold training etc as well as a wide area of other tasks in order to ensure the function is executing the annual plan, addressing ad hoc issues etc in the most efficient manner. You will be part of a team of five covering Trustly’s Swedish operations. Trustly’s company language is English.
 





  




**What you’ll do:** 
* Execute on the DPO annual plan which includes e.g. control activities, risk assessment and trainingDrafting of reports, e.g. to the board of directors
* Act as the primary contact with the Swedish Authority for Privacy Protection (Sw:Integritetsskyddsmyndigheten) or another competent authority supervising Trustly, ensuring all communication, reports and responses to regulatory requests are accurate, completed and submitted on time
* Assist in developing and implementing compliance management framework including drafting and revising internal governing documents (policies etc)
* Advice and support internal stakeholders on DPO / compliance related matters
* Stay abreast of changes in legislation, guidelines, and industry best practices related to GDPR and make suggestions with respect to related compliance policy and procedure enhancements



  




**Who you are:** 
* You have an academic degree, preferably in law, with relevant working experience from a regulatory/supervisory financial environment or from a consultancy firm working with Data Protection, compliance or risk related issues towards the financial industry
* Experience in risk management and performing controls is an advantage
* Previous working experience regarding PSD2 or AML/CFT is an advantage
* A team player with high communication skills and the ability to deal with diverse teams of both internal and external stakeholders in a proactive manner
* Can-do attitude and take ownership of given and proactively identified tasks
* Fluent in English and Swedish



  




**What’s In It For You?** 
* **Shape Your Role and Make an Impact** 
 : A role where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously take on exciting new challenges
* **Fantastic** 
**Benefits** 
 :
* **30 days of holiday** 
 for a healthy work-life balance
* **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
* **Parental leave top-up** 
 , supporting you during family milestones
* **Daily breakfast** 
 and other on-site perks to make your day that much easier
* Plus many more benefits designed to support your well-being!






  




  














  






 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.******

title: Säljare företagskunder
description:
**Företagssäljare till Telink.** 

  





**Är du en driven och resultatfokuserad säljare med passion för kundrelationer och teknik? Vill du vara en del av ett framgångsrikt företag på en spännande resa? Då har vi jobbet för dig!** 




  





 Telink PBX är en ledande leverantör av kommunikationslösningar med fokus på att erbjuda smidiga och moderna telefoni och AI tjänster för företag. Vi befinner oss på en framgångsresa och söker nu nya kollegor som vill vara med och forma framtiden tillsammans med oss. Om du brinner för försäljning, kundnöjdhet och teknik, är detta möjligheten för dig!
 



  





  




**Din roll** 

  





**Som företagssäljare hos Telink PBX kommer du att:** 



* **Bygga och utveckla kundrelationer** 
 : Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och skapa långsiktiga samarbeten med företag.
* **Presentera och sälja våra tjänster** 
 : Förstå kundernas behov och föreslå lösningar som hjälper dem att förbättra sin verksamhet med våra kommunikationslösningar.
* **Följa upp leads** 
 : Aktivt bearbeta inkommande förfrågningar och skapa nya affärskontakter.
* **Kontakta nya kunder** 
 : Boka fysiska och digitala möten för att demonstrera våra tjänster och skapa affärsmöjligheter.
* **Nå och överträffa säljmål** 
 : Bidra till företagets tillväxt genom att leverera mätbara resultat.
* **Hålla dig uppdaterad** 
 : Följa marknadstrender och teknikutveckling för att erbjuda relevanta lösningar till våra kunder.



  





  




**Din profil** 

  





**Vi tror att du som söker:** 



* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning, gärna inom IT eller telekom.
* Är kommunikativ och har en förmåga att skapa förtroende hos kunder.
* Är resultatorienterad och motiveras av att uppnå och överträffa mål.
* Har en god teknisk förståelse och kan snabbt sätta dig in i våra tjänster och produkter.
* Har B-körkort och möjlighet att resa vid behov.



 Det är meriterande om du tidigare har arbetat med telefonilösningar eller IT-tjänster.
 



  





  




 Vad vi erbjuder
   


**Hos Telink PBX får du:** 



* En spännande och utmanande roll med stora möjligheter till utveckling.
* En attraktiv lönemodell med både fast och prestationsbaserad ersättning.
* Möjligheten att arbeta med marknadsledande produkter och tjänster.
* Ett engagerat och sammansvetsat team där vi stöttar varandra och har kul tillsammans.
* Kontinuerlig utbildning och kompetensutveckling.
* En chans att vara med på Telinks framgångsresa och bidra till vår fortsatta tillväxt.



  





  




 Ansökan
   


 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka din ansökan med CV och personligt brev till aziz@telink.se. Skriv "Företagssäljare" i ämnesraden. Intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Windows & Azure Consultant
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva spännande projekt inom molnlösningar och IT-infrastruktur? På Advania hjälper vi våra kunder att modernisera sin IT-miljö, säkerställa stabil drift och skapa säkra, effektiva IT-lösningar. Som en del av vårt team får du möjlighet att utvecklas inom Microsofts teknologier och arbeta med kunniga kollegor i en miljö som uppmuntrar lärande och samarbete.*
 Windows & Azure Consultant på Advania 🚀
   

  

 Du får i rollen som Windows & Azure-Consultant arbeta hands-on med beställningar, migreringar och implementeringar av IT-lösningar, samtidigt som du övervakar och säkerställer att vi upprätthåller våra SLA-nivåer och kundåtaganden. Dina arbetsuppgifter omfattar bla:
   

  

  

* Drift och förvaltning av managerade tjänster och centrala servermiljöer.
* Implementering och drift i Microsoft Azure-miljöer.
* Change och incident-hantering samt tekniska leveranser.
* Säkerställa säkerhet och funktionalitet i kundernas IT-lösningar.


 Här hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett mindre team på 4-6 personer och bli en del av en större grupp med bred specialistkompetens inom exempelvis nätverk, Windows Server, Managed Client, Microsoft SQL och Microsoft 365. Du samarbetar nära andra konsulter inom Operations samt med våra sälj- och projektteam.
   

  

 Vad som gör denna roll unik? ⭐
   

  

 Det här är din chans att ta steget in i en konsultroll där din vilja att utvecklas och din inställning väger lika tungt som tidigare erfarenhet. Hos oss får du arbeta med innovativa tekniska lösningar och bygga på din kompetens inom Microsofts plattformar i en miljö som stöttar din personliga och professionella utveckling.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 Vi tror att du är i början av din karriär inom IT-infrastruktur, fast har viljan och drivet att utvecklas till en nyckelperson i vårt team. Vi ger dig verktygen och stödet du behöver för att nå dit. Som person är du engagerad, ansvarstagande och brinner för att leverera värde till kunder det gör du dels tack vare att du uppskattar kunddialogen och har en serviceinriktad attityd.
   

  

  

* Högskole- eller yrkeshögskoleutbildning inom infrastruktur och säkerhet eller 2-3 års motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Meriterande med Certifiering inom AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate eller AZ-800 Administering Windows Server Hybrid Core Infrastructure, alternativt motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Det är meriterande om du är bekant med MSP-branschen


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Alla slutkandidater kommer att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess utöver personlighet- och logiktest. Välkommen att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten eller processen.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Head of Commercial
description:
We are a fast-growing media scale-up from Stockholm making it easier for users to discover and enjoy their favourite movies and series across multiple streaming platforms.
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Head of Commercial** 
 to build and execute commercial strategies, manage partnerships, and identify new business opportunities.
 



  





 You will lead and develop our commercial team, working closely with product and leadership to expand the reach of our data and platform to unlock new revenue streams.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 



* Lead and develop our commercial strategy, driving revenue through innovative partnerships, collaborations, and direct sales.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with our customers, national and international streaming partners, and media agencies.
* Oversee the creation and execution of go-to-market strategies that drive long-term growth and ensure commercial success for us and our partners.
* Work closely with product development to ensure our platform meets market demands and opens new business opportunities.
* Utilize data and insights to optimize campaigns and ensure our partners benefit from our unique offerings.



  





**Who You Are:** 



* You have 7+ years of experience in sales, business development, or commercial leadership within media, advertising, marketing-tech, or digital industries.
* Proven experience leading a commercial team that drives revenue and builds long-lasting partnerships.
* Strong understanding of the digital and streaming landscapes in the Nordics, with established relationships in media and/or entertainment.
* Strategic thinker with a demonstrated ability to execute complex initiatives and grow business across multiple markets.
* Comfortable with cross-functional collaboration, working with product teams, data analysts, and external partners.
* Fluency in English and Swedish



  





**What We Offer:** 



* The opportunity to lead commercial initiatives for a fast-growing platform that simplifies the streaming experience for millions of users.
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where you’ll be free to influence and shape our commercial strategy.
* A premium work environment that values innovation and creativity.
* Opportunities for significant growth and personal development.



  





**Apply now and be part of the future of content discovery!**

title: CRM Business Analyst
description:
Är du vår nästa CRM Business Analyst, en strategisk partner till våra kunder som även hjälper dem att förbättra sina kundstrategier, processer och arbetssätt samt digitalisera sitt kundarbete? I rollen sammarbetar man med tvärfunktionella team för att analysera affärskrav, designa effektiva CRM-lösningar och säkerställa framgångsrik implementering av CRM-projekt.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Affärsanalys
 
 : Analys av processer, data och system för att förstå hur verksamheten fungerar och var det finns utrymme för förbättringar. Du drivs av att identifiera möjligheter till effektivisering och optimering av kundens arbetsflöden.
* Kravhantering
 
 : Samla in, analysera, prioritera och dokumentera affärs- och användarkrav. Detta innebär att intervjua våra kunder, genomföra workshops och skapa kravdokument som ligger till grund för de CRM-lösningar som vi utvecklar.
* Lösningsspecifikation
 
 : Skapa detaljerade specifikationer som beskriver hur CRM:et bör utformas och fungera för att möta affärsbehoven.
* Testning och validering
 
 : Säkerställa att den implementerade lösningen uppfyller de definierade kraven och fungerar som förväntat.
* Projektledning
 
 : Du är en central person i våra projekt och samarbetar med utvecklare, projektledare och olika intressenter hos kunden för att säkerställa leverans enligt tidsplan och budget.
* Affärsutveckling
 
 : Som konsult på Releye är det viktigt att ha ett intresse för att förstå kundens behov, hitta nya möjligheter och ta fram lösningsförslag.
* Utveckling och lärande
 
 : För att vi ska leverera projekt i absoluta framkant är det viktigt att du håller dig uppdaterad om branschtrender och best practice inom CRM.
* Konfigurering av CRM-plattformen
 
 : För denna roll krävs det ibland att du själv även är den som anpassar och skräddarsyr lösningen efter kundens behov, genom konfigurering och low-/no code.



  





 Som konsult på Releye får du möjighet att ta på dig olika hattar i olika projekt, Som CRM Business Analyst är därmed arbetsuppgifterna varierande.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har flera års erfarenhet av att jobba som Business Analyst, Business Architect eller Systems Architect
* Har erfarenhet av CRM och att jobba med någon av de processer som vi arbetar med (sälj, service eller marketing automation)
* Är van att arbeta efter agila projektmetoder
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult
* Har högskoleutbildning, t.ex. Data- och systemvetenskap, eller annan relevant teknisk universitetsutbildning eller yrkesutbildning.
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet från någon eller några av de plattformar som vi jobbar med (Salesforce eller Microsoft Dynamics)
* Meriterande är också om du har kunskap om UML och erfarenhet av att designa integrationer



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 



* Strukturerad och noggrann
* God kommunikationsförmåga
* Prestigelös
* Orädd
* Utåtriktad och trivs med att jobba med många kontaktytor både internt och hos kund



  





 Releye är ett familjärt strategi- och IT-företag som Automatiserar, Digitaliserar och Transformerar kundprocesser, och ser till att de anpassas till den nya digitala världen. Vi är specialister inom Microsoft CRM och Salesforce och vi är stolta över att ha några av Sveriges mest kända varumärken som våra kunder. Tillsammans med våra kunder tar vi fram proaktiva kundupplevelser.
 



 Releye växer och behöver dig som värdesätter härliga kollegor, utmanande kundprojekt och en utvecklande arbetsplats. Vi har innovationsdagar, lösningar i absoluta framkant och ett skönt framåtlutat gäng som vill bli fler.

title: OpenShift plattformstekniker
description:
Vill du jobba med teknik i framkant samtidigt som bidra till samhällsnytta? Vill du vara med och forma Skatteverkets och våra kundmyndigheters framtida it-miljö? På Skatteverkets it-avdelning bygger vi inte bara bra system utan även grunden för ett väl fungerande samhälle. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverkets it-avdelning är en av Sveriges största, med en stor och komplex it-miljö. Vi ansvarar för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av Skatteverkets- och våra kunders it-system. Nu går vi in i en ny fas av uppbyggnad och innovation då vi kommer att stärka vår leverans av it-tjänster och it-drift till fler statliga myndigheter. Därför utökar vi nu vårt team som ansvar för Red Hat Linux och OpenShift plattformen. Tillsammans med kunniga och nytänkande kollegor kommer du bidra till Skatteverkets uppdrag att skapa samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Du arbetar i ett team som arbetar Gitops inriktat. Du kommer tillsammans med övriga i teamet arbeta med design, utveckling och härdning av Skatteverkets Linuxplattform och Red Hat OpenShift containerplattform. I teamet arbetar ni även tillsammans med andra intressenter där ni identifiera förbättringar, designar och utvecklar lösningar för att förbättra likväl som att effektivisera plattformarna. Arbetet sker både i team och individuellt. I rollen ingår även att automatisera och förbättra Skatteverkets leveranser tillsammans med andra.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom it, alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling och förvaltning av Open Shift eller Kubernetes plattformar
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete med automatisering och orkestrering med Ansible och Kubernetes Operators eller motsvarande
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete med Infrastructure as Code (IaC)


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av Red Hat Linux alternativt likvärdig Linux Enterprise distrubition som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant. Relevant erfarenhet av Git, klusterhantering i OpenShift och/eller agilt arbetssätt är även det önskvärt.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg eller Göteborg | Län: Ospecificerad arbetsort | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/456 | Kontakt: Caroline Törnkvist (HR-specialist rekrytering) caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, Daniel Bynander (Rekryterande chef) daniel.bynander@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-18 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-15

title: Engineering Director, Machine Learning I Shared Technology
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Join King, a leader in mobile gaming, as an Engineering Director. This pivotal role directs the engineering leadership across the Experience Optimisation organisation, one out of two departments within the Data/ML domain within Shared Tech, reporting to the VP of Engineering. You will lead a strong technical team, chartered with building key strategic capabilities for King in the ML space and support expanding our Data superpower.
   

  

 Why Join us?
   

  

 At King, we believe that exceptional leadership coupled with technical expertise fosters outstanding results. As an Engineering Director at King, you will impact the full game portfolio including one of the world's most beloved games, Candy Crush Saga. You will work at a massive scale in terms of Data and have an opportunity to have a big impact on King's strategic objectives.
   

  

 Collaborating with the rest of the data/ml domain leadership team, you will help translate our strategic plan into high quality delivery plans that enables us to fulfill our mission. You will help evolve the engineering organization to efficiently implement the strategy, while also attracting and growing our top talent. Additionally, you will drive talent initiatives and process improvements that contribute to the overall success of the engineering organization in both Data/ML, Shared Tech and King.
   

  

 We provide a collaborative, open, and engaging work environment that values diversity, inclusivity, and trust. Innovation and creativity are at the heart of what we do, and we actively encourage fresh ideas and new perspectives. This role offers a unique opportunity to grow your career in a dynamic and thriving industry, with the support of a talented and dedicated team.
   

  

**Your role within the Kingdom**
 Technology & Strategy
   

  

* Develop and oversee the successful execution of Technology and Engineering strategies together with the Tech Director and Engineering Managers for the Experience Optimization Department.
* Oversee and enhance all aspects of the engineering lifecycle including recruitment, onboarding and performance management.
* Foster a strong engineering culture that supports development, recognizes achievements, and nurtures professional growth.


 Leadership
   

  

* Lead, inspire, act as a role model, and grow a team of talented engineering leaders and technical staff to accelerate our game teams to deliver innovative features to millions of players globally.


**Skills To Create Thrills**
* Hands-on experience in the machine learning space. Experience from personalisation efforts is a big plus.
* A good understanding of AB testing
* Strong technical background in software engineering.
* Proven experience in leading large-scale technical organizations (20+ people) within software development industries. Experience from leading leaders.
* Demonstrable ability to formulate and execute tech and engineering strategies that meet business needs.
* Exceptional people management, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within technical teams.


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Senior Management Consultant
description:
**What We Are Looking For**
* 10 years + Management Consulting experience. You should have substantial experience in the trade of Management Consulting, having spent time at a well-recognised consulting firm.
* Possess excellent business development skills, with a strong network and reputation in the marketplace.
* Currently working as a Project or Programme Manager within the Business Transformation, Digital/IT Management Consulting and Business Development space. Result driven with long experience from driving strategically important projects on behalf of clients.
* Self-motivated, forward leaning consultant with the ability to embrace the Aurentor way of working quickly and achieve lasting results together with our clients.
* Masters Educated


**What We Can Offer**
* A truly unique and dedicated way of consulting, with a focus on re-establishing the good reputation of consulting!
* The opportunity to work at senior to executive level at our clients, with their most complex and business critical projects, together with some of the most experienced and well-respected management consultants in the business.
* A prestigious-less and flat hierarchal structure, to make sure we deliver tangible value to our clients.
* A culture that focus on value delivered but still acknowledge life’s different situations and circumstances, and therefore adopt a humane view to your work/life balance.
* A market leading and unique salary model (and profit share bonus) which is in line with our business spirit and linked to your own performance as well as that of the company.


**What You Will Do**
* We are looking to recruit Senior Management Consultants with an entrepreneurial mind-set.
* You will work in close collaboration with our clients on Strategy Implementation, Business Design and Business Transformation projects.
* You will work in teams together with your colleagues and normally with the partners liaising closely with our client’s senior management team (c-suite) to deliver tangible value on some of their most complex and business critical projects and programs
* You will focus on value and never Aurentor’s or your own utilization.
* You will be expected to develop long term relationships with our clients, and in time create new business opportunities and business deals


**Who is** 
**Aurentor?**
 Aurentor is a niche management consulting company created in 2010. We are a team of experienced management consultants who share two simple aims: to deliver turnarounds, transitions and transformations for our clients, and to change the way people think about consultants. We do this by aligning our objectives perfectly with those of our clients, and by rolling up our sleeves and working side by side with them and their employees so we achieve the desired results together.
   

  

 Our consultants have the experience to understand the challenges our clients face, the skills to assume responsibility and the determination to see transformations through.
   

  

 Aurentor is a small, agile team of visionary consultants, all with proven success in driving turnarounds and business transformation.
   

  

 As part of the Newground Alliance – a multi-sector group of independent consultants based in Stockholm, Sweden – working at Aurentor allows you to meet, work and socialize with team of colleagues who share a people-centric vision for our industry.

title: Senior Technology Architect | Power BI, Splunk, GCP | Helsingborg
description:
**Job Description**
**Role – Senior Technical Architect
   

  

 Technology – Power BI, GCP, Splunk, ServiceNow
   

  

 Location – Helsinborg, Sweden
   

  

 Business Unit – RCLADM2
   

  

 Compensation – Competitive (including bonus)**
**Job Description**
 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.
   

  

 At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Senior Technical Architect, you will be responsible for setting the technical vision and leading the architectural strategy of an organization, making high-level decisions, driving innovation, and mentoring other architects by overseeing the design, implementation, and maintenance of complex technical systems, while collaborating closely with stakeholders and development teams to ensure alignment with business goals and best practices; key responsibilities include defining architecture standards, evaluating new technologies, guiding technical decision-making, and providing technical leadership across projects. Interaction with other teams in client organization and drive solution.
   

  

**Required**
* Good hands on on Power BI, GCP, Splunk, ServiceNow and UI technologies.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to develop a comprehensive observability strategy aligned with business objectives, identifying key metrics, logs, and traces to monitor.
* Ability to create a robust and scalable platform architecture that includes data ingestion and processing pipelines, data storage and management strategies, visualization and reporting mechanisms, alerting and notification systems, iintegration with existing IT infrastructure and tools
* Ability to define data models for storing and analysing telemetry data, ensuring efficient querying and reporting.
* Good understanding about implementing robust security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.
* Strong understanding of Devops, experience in working with Cloud Platforms
* Provide technical leadership to the development team, guiding them on best practices, coding standards, and troubleshooting techniques.
* Familiarity with Splunk Architecture, Splunk apps (Splunk ITSI).
* Encourage innovation and experimentation to explore new approaches to observability.


**Preferred**
* Responsible for designing, developing, and overseeing the overall architecture
* Working closely with stakeholders and co-workers at onsite to gather, analyse, and translate business requirements into detailed system specifications and design documents.
* Creating detailed system architecture documentation, diagrams, and presentations to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Hands-on experience on Designing and implementing the end-to-end observability solutions, including integrations and APIs, to view end-to-end service flows.
* Hands-on experience on Designing and setting up an AIOps models for automated remediation workflows.


**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* High analytical skills
* A high degree of initiative and flexibility
* High customer orientation
* High quality awareness
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**About Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next.
   

  

**All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer**

title: Cybersäkerhetsarkitekt till Conscia!
description:
*Andas du cybersäkerhet och vill vara en del av ett ledande företag inom IT-infrastruktur och säkerhet? Är du redo att ta nästa steg i karriären och bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens säkerhetslösningar? Då är rollen som Cybersäkerhetsarkitekt hos Conscia perfekt för dig!*
**Din vardag**
 Som Cybersäkerhetsarkitekt på Conscia blir du en del av presales-teamet som består av åtta specialister och arkitekter. Tillsammans stödjer ni säljarna genom att tillföra djup kompetens inom era respektive expertområden.
   

  

 I takt med att cybersäkerhet blir alltmer kritiskt, satsar Conscia på att stärka sin marknadsposition och bredda sitt erbjudande för att möta kundernas ökande behov. I denna roll blir du en nyckelperson som hjälper till att driva utvecklingen av Conscias erbjudande inom cybersäkerhet.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära såväl säljare som kunder och tar en aktiv roll i att bygga och definiera nya tjänster, samtidigt som du fungerar som en pålitlig rådgivare inom cybersäkerhet. Du stödjer hela säljprocessen genom att utföra nulägesanalyser, identifiera behov och rekommendera åtgärder.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du även vara en naturlig kontaktpunkt för Conscias prisbelönta SOC lokaliserad i Slovenien som bland annat har en kraftfull Managed Detection & Response tjänst.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 
 :
   

  

* Evangelist och tankeledarskap inom cybersäkerhet genom att delta i och leda workshops, utbildningar, föreläsningar och webinarier.
* Tekniskt och affärsmässigt stöd genom hela säljcykeln
* Utveckling utav nya lösningar, tjänster och förmågor inom cybersäkerhet
* Presale för SOC och managerade lösningar inom cybersäkerhet


**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen som Cybersäkerhetsarkitekt tror vi att du minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med cybersäkerhet och har ett starkt intresse utav området. Du drivs att hjälpa kunder och bygga långsiktiga relationer. Vidare har du meriterande certifikat inom området (CISSP eller motsvarade) samt att du talar och skriver svenska/engelska flytande.
   

  

 Som person är du trygg in din roll och van vid att agera rådgivare. Du trivs i en miljö där man delar med sig av sin kunskap. Vidare har du ett starkt självledarskap och tar ett stort ansvar i din roll.
   

  

 Bakgrunds-och referenskontroll kommer att vara en del av processen.
   

  

**Kontakt**
*Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Gustaf Linder, gustaf.linder@wiseit.se. Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i* 
 Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter
 *. Urval sker löpande.* 
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Passar vi dig?**
 Conscia är en ledande europeisk systemintegratör med inriktning på säker IT-infrastruktur. Conscia är ett bolag som fokuserar starkt på kompetens och vi vill vara det naturliga valet när kunder vill ha en expert leverans. Conscia är en grupp som idag finns i Sverige, Norge, Danmark, England, Nederländerna, Tyskland och Slovenien. Conscia som koncern har sitthuvudkontor i Köpenhamn.
   

  

 Våra tjänster består idag av både lokalt producerade och internationella gemensamma tjänster inom Conscia-gruppen. Inom cybersäkerhetsområdet arbetar Conscia-gruppen även med bland annat lösningar från Cisco, Splunk, PaloAlto, Microsoft, Logpoint, VMware mfl.
   

  

 Vi är idag ca 115 anställda och är nu på jakt efter ytterligare en medarbetare som vill vara med i vår starka utveckling framåt. Vi på Conscia är snabbrörliga medfamiljekänsla och högt i tak, där alla medarbetare bidrar mycket aktivt i vårutveckling.
   

  

 Det svenska huvudkontoret huserar i mycket fräscha lokaler i DN-huset på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Vi har även kontor i Borlänge, Göteborg, Malmö och Västerås.

title: Application Specialist (Salesforce)
description:
At Tobii, we want to empower businesses and professionals with revolutionary insights into human behavior using the powers of eye tracking and attention computing. We are already making it, and we want to leverage further. We need people who are modern product thinkers, have an eye for technology, and beyond ready to amaze customers.
 



  





 Based at our HQ in Stockholm, our new
 **Application Specialist (Salesforce)** 
 serves as the technical owner of our Sales & Marketing application services, with a primary focus on our CRM system, Salesforce.
 



  





**As an Application Specialist (Salesforce), a week could look like this:** 



* Consult business requesters on the best technical solution for their requirements, together with other colleagues at Global IT and consider the bigger picture in the overall system / data landscape and impact on the business
* Resolving incidents, service requests and problems for our business applications as 2nd / 3rd level support
* Collaboration with the IT Core Infrastructure and IT Operations teams to install, configure, maintain, restore, or upgrade business applications
* To prioritize, develop, test, deploy, communicate, and document changes and releases
* Ensuring that application permissions are set up on a need-to-know/use basis and perform access control reviews. Ensure that we have the proper licenses for all our users
* Supporting service owners in defining strategies how to develop our application services further
* Occasionally manage projects and support the rest of the IT team by contributing to projects
* Work together with software vendors or consultants to resolve incidents or change the applications
* Documenting your business applications, ways of working and best practices
* Develop, coordinate, and conduct education for end users, with a focus on how to use our applications



  





**Our humble expectations from you:** 



* Proven experience in Salesforce Sales Cloud and Salesforce Flow
* Very good knowledge of business applications and their system architecture (e.g. CRM, ERP, communication & collaboration tools, HR systems), integrations, processes, best practices.
* Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Information Technology, Economics or similar
* Possess good business analysis skills: identify business requirements, consult stakeholders, find solutions with them
* Have excellent English language skills verbal and written; able to communicate clearly towards users and colleagues within Global IT
* Demonstrate agile way of working and data literacy



  





**Are you our next Tobiian?** 




 We are curious about you! Let us know about your background, experiences and where you’re heading. Due to GDPR, we will only review those applications directed to our career page - so please submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through it!
 



  





**Being a Tobiian** 




 We believe in diversity and equal opportunity. At Tobii we want you to be yourself and we welcome applicants from all walks of life. It’s all about passion, innovation and making things real. Each day is different here at Tobii, hopefully, this is something that motivates you! We want you to be comfortable at work so come in wearing high heels or flip flops as long as you feel that's who you want to be, we're looking for a good personal fit and believe that diversity is the spice of life!

title: Game Product Owner (Slot Producer)
description:
Wanna be truly creative and work with a diverse gaming product from seed to actual released product? Maybe sick of releasing just one game every third or fifth year? Come join us as a game producer and be insanely creative and even be able to release your games before you are sick of them!
   

  

 We want to stand out and are not afraid to make games that changes the online slots industry. Are you the person that can drive our products to the next level? Then we are very interested in getting in contact with you. We want you to fulfil one of our two wishes; that you either come from the gaming industry, or even better, are working specifically with slot games and have great knowledge in casino products. You need to have a general passion for games!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Innovative thinker and daredevil that wants to create new and exciting game concepts.
* Making sure that the games teams run smoothly and can deliver badass slots.
* Guide and give feedback on game productions, not just your own.
* Create an excellent player experience and continuously improving our slot games production.
* Ready to work with all aspects of the product – development, math, compliance, marketing and sales.
* Research, play and study slot games and watch market trends and competitors.


 Who you are
   

  

* Passionate to create fun and exciting games.
* A person that can help our amazing team of developers create the best game in the casino market!
* You love to drive and create the game concepts and our way forward, to build a solid games portfolio together with our team.
* Can perfectly switch between working with developers one day and sales and customers the next.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills (a classic!)
* Not afraid to make tough decisions and kill your darlings.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Game production experience within iGaming or Gaming industry.
* Gaming and slots nerd.
* Proven project- and/or people management skills.
* Understanding of mathematical fundamentals of slots.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta, Romania and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. We have no dependencies on other systems, which allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Supply Chain Planner
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





**As a Supply Chain Planner ,** 
 you will ensure we have the right amount of supply available to meet demand for sales, demos and rentals in EUROW (Europe and Asia Pacific region) by continuously analyzing, and adjusting inventory levels.
 



  





 In this experience, you will work strategically with other teams such as Logistics, Quality Assurance and Sourcing to continuously optimize Tobii Dynavox’s global supply chain. This is an excellent opportunity for who enjoys being part of a scaling and changing environment!
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Create and perform the master plan of a specific set of items and locations by developing safety stock levels, setting supply plans, purchasing and managing inventory to the required safety stock levels.
* Integrate individual plans into the model and/or ERP, including all items that are sold and used for repairs.
* Reduce inventory supply levels at the end of manufacturing or during end-of-life decisions.
* Observe KPIs and adjust plan to keep inventory levels at optimal levels for all devices, accessories and repair parts.
* Act as purchasing agent for applicable vendors.
* Track and trace freight of items within area of responsibility.
* Recommend buffer stock amounts and set parameters on safety stock levels.
* Continuously improve supply chain processes to increase sales and decrease costs.



  





**We are looking for someone that has:** 



* Equivalent of a bachelor’s degree or 5 years of experience in Supply Chain and/or Operations roles.
* At least 2 years of experience using MRP and/or ERP systems.
* Proficiency in Excel (e.g. formulas, charts and Pivot Tables) and PowerBI.
* Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with different teams.
* Strong analytical skills.
* Fluency in both written and spoken English in professional setting.



  





**Please Note:** 
 This is a
 **hybrid** 
 role (1-3 days in our Stockholm office) therefore, we welcome candidates who are within commuting distance in the Stockholm region. This role also includes occasional
 **(10%) international travel** 
 to our suppliers and sales partners around the world, which would be communicated weeks in advance.
 



  





**What is next?** 




 Please share your questions at mine.hacisalihoglu@tobiidynavox.com and submit your resume and/or LinkedIn profile (
 **in English only** 
 ) through our
 **career page.** 
 We look forward to your application!
 



  





 We are committed to sustainability, contributing directly to several of the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals, particularly SDGs 3, 4, and 10. Learn more about our impact in our annual and sustainability report.
 



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Global Procurement Manager - Electric Mobility
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

**You will:**
* Work cross-functionally and closely with leaders across the company to understand Einride value proposition and business requirements
* Lead the development and execution of category strategies for Medium- and Heavy-Duty Electric Vehicles and Trailers, in collaboration with relevant stakeholders such as Commercial, Operations and Finance, enabling the execution of Einride’s Electric Mobility strategy
* Develop partnerships and ensure a sustainable, scalable and high performing supply network enabling the transformation of the electric and autonomous transport landscape
* Lead Source to Contract activities, such as supplier identification and selection, negotiation and contract lifecycle management
* Develop and drive supplier relationship management and performance management in close collaboration with stakeholders such as Operations and Finance, enabling end-to-end value creation and value capture
* Lead major cost-out initiatives and tenders enabling e.g. new market entry, through cross-functional project teams
* Develop strong relationships and manage internal and external stakeholders at all levels ensuring effective strategy development and execution


**We expect you to:**
* Have several years of industry related experience in global procurement and category management functions
* Bring proven cross-functional leadership skills with the ability to foster a culture of collaboration
* Be open minded, self-reflective, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to influence internal and external stakeholders
* Bring solid analytical skills with the ability to analyse complex sets of data and draw insights and conclusionsBe self-motivated and result-oriented


 This is a full-time position preferably based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
   

  

 Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

title: SAP Consultant
description:
We are looking for a skilled SAP Consultant to join a dynamic team working on a high-impact Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) Sales business transformation project for a leader in the manufacturing industry. You’ll play a pivotal role in shaping innovative solutions that redefine the end-to-end sales process, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver excellence.
   

  

**Your tasks**
* Represent the SAP SD module in the end-to-end (E2E) delivery process of a D2C Sales transformation project
* Use your SAP expertise to design and implement solutions aligned with business needs
* Collaborate with project managers, business sponsors, and end-users to clarify project scope and functional requirements
* Analyze and document processes, providing clear and professional presentations on analysis, design, and solutions


**Requirements**
* SAP SD (SOM, Pricing, and Billing) or broad experience in other SAP modules (MM, WM, FI) with a willingness to expand knowledge of SD
* Ability to read and debug ABAP code
* Creation of technical and functional documentation
* Understanding of integration points with related SAP modules (FI, CO, LE, WM, PI) to ensure seamless cross-module functionality
* Experience working closely with application end-users


 Job no. 250108-VNQU3

title: Senior Game Designer to Hearts of Iron
description:
*As a Game Designer you will be focusing on designing and balancing engaging gameplay mechanics. Hearts of Iron, the grand strategy wargame, have over a million players monthly (and growing) expectantly waiting for what’s next for their favorite franchise.*
**Game Designer Hearts of Iron**
 We're on the lookout for a game designer driven by a passion for their craft and a fervor for crafting thrilling experiences for our players. If you're someone who finds motivation in the autonomy to lead tasks and deliver outstanding results, you're the ideal fit. Your element is a creative and collaborative space where the enthusiasm for our work is infectious, and everyone around you is not just doing a job but crafting the games we all love
 **.** 
 A keen interest in history and its narratives is a great plus.
   

  

**Your mission**
 You will be working closely with the Game Director and be the owner of the design in feature teams. Taking ownership of the designs means that you will be working hands-on from research, to design, implementation and balancing of gameplay systems. This includes being adept at communicating with your peers and colleagues in other disciplines, writing and maintaining design documents as well as testing implemented features and making sure they live up to expectations.
   

  

 Your role goes beyond crafting engaging game play - it involves actively engaging with our community, giving sneak peaks of yours & the team's latest for work as well as working closely with our marketing team to come up with the best way to showcase the game. In doing this you will be central to shaping the interaction with the people that matters most to us - our players.
   

  

**Skills That We Are Looking For**
* Solid work experience in system design
* Solid work experience in gameplay design
* Experience with scripting
* Interest in strategy/war games; PDS games in particular
* Fluency in English


 As a creative force at Paradox, you are expected to have a genuine passion for Grand Strategy Games and a good understanding of what makes them so appealing to our players.
   

  

*We will only recruit locally for this position*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Digital Client Manager
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Digital Client Manager** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Digital Client Manager, you will play a key role in supporting the growth of Viaplay’s digital ad sales business. You will assist in prospecting new leads, nurturing client relationships, and supporting campaign optimization efforts. The ideal candidate will bring experience in digital ad sales and have established relationships within the media industry, which will help drive revenue growth and enhance our partnerships.
   

  

**Prospecting And Lead Generation**
* Research and identify new business opportunities, including media agencies, programmatic trading desks, and brands in need of digital advertising solutions.
* Assist in outreach efforts to generate interest, including cold calling, email campaigns, and following up with leads.
* Qualify new leads, maintain an organized list of potential clients, and keep track of communication for future outreach.


**Client Relationship Management And Support**
* Support senior team members in managing relationships with key stakeholders, including media agencies, trading desks, and clients.
* Assist in handling client inquiries, providing support on digital advertising solutions, and helping maintain ongoing communications.
* Leverage established relationships within the media industry to facilitate introductions, build trust, and create opportunities for business growth.


**Campaign Management And Optimization**
* Assist with the setup, monitoring, and optimization of digital ad campaigns, ensuring they align with client objectives.
* Collaborate with senior team members to analyze campaign performance and provide insights and recommendations for optimization.
* Ensure client goals and KPIs are met by actively managing the day-to-day execution of campaigns.


**Programmatic Expertise And Knowledge Development**
* Develop and expand your understanding of programmatic advertising platforms (e.g., DSPs, SSPs) and tools used to optimize campaign performance.
* Stay informed about digital advertising trends, programmatic developments, and best practices within the industry.
* Conduct research and help provide insights to clients on emerging trends and how Viaplay’s solutions can help meet their needs.


**Collaboration And Coordination**
* Work alongside internal teams, including ad operations, product, and marketing, to ensure smooth campaign execution and maximum client satisfaction.
* Assist in preparing presentations, proposals, and pitches for new and existing clients.
* Collaborate with senior team members to help expand Viaplay's media partnerships and improve the sales process.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

**Experience In Digital Ad Sales**
* Previous experience in digital ad sales or media buying, with a good understanding of the digital advertising landscape and programmatic platforms.
* Established relationships within the media industry (e.g., media agencies, trading desks, advertisers) that can be leveraged for business development.


**Strong Communication Skills**
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to professionally interact with clients, media agencies, and internal teams.
* Ability to build trust with clients and stakeholders, supporting long-term relationships.


**Organizational And Project Management Skills**
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects effectively, with strong attention to detail.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and meeting deadlines while maintaining high service standards.


**Technical Proficiency**
* Experience with digital media planning tools, analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), and CRM systems.
* Familiarity with programmatic platforms (e.g., The Trade Desk, MediaMath, Xandr) and other ad tech tools is a plus.


**Results-Oriented And Client-Focused**
* A performance-driven mindset, focused on achieving client goals and improving campaign results.
* Ability to analyze data, assess campaign performance, and implement optimization strategies.


**Desired Attributes**
* Proactive, with a solutions-oriented mindset and eagerness to learn and grow within the digital advertising field.
* Team player who thrives in a collaborative, dynamic environment.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and a customer-first approach.
