**Education And Qualifications**
* Degree in Marketing, Business, Digital Media, or a related field.
* Relevant experience in digital ad sales or programmatic advertising, with a solid understanding of the industry.
* Certifications or additional training in programmatic advertising or ad tech platforms is a plus.


 What we offer you
   

  

**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior Sales Executive, Baltics
description:
Brite Payments is a leading European Account to Account (A2A) payment provider (powered by Open Banking) of Instant Payments and Payouts. We provide a faster, smarter and more secure payment experience for merchants and their users.
   

  

***Want to join us on our journey? The future is brite!***
 As a Senior Sales Executive, Baltics you will play a leading role in the region's commercial success by finding, selling and closing new business opportunities. You will be part of an experienced, driven and inclusive team that is changing the face of payments by unlocking Instant, Account-to-Account payments and payouts.
   

  

**Are you a Brite mind?**
 We are looking for individuals with a proven sales track record of winning new business and achieving ambitious targets with enterprise merchants in The Baltics. This role requires a critical understanding of merchant needs and payment challenges, who can translate these into a clear and compelling sales motion.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have previous experience in payments and with an existing professional network within one or more of our target verticals, these include but are not limited to: E-commerce / Financial Services & Insurance / Digital Platforms / Travel and mobility.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will bring:
   

  

* 5 + years of sales experience within a payments, fintech, banking leader
* Proficient in sales methodologies, multi-threaded sales and value selling
* Experienced selling to Enterprise merchants
* Ability to outbound themselves in a efficient and scalable way
* Diligent with forecasting, data and pricing
* Salesforce & commercial tooling experience
* Great presentation and communication skills
* Fluent in English


**Your Responsibilities**
* Build a strong pipeline within your territory plan, identifying and engaging with all relevant merchants and stakeholders.
* Leverage your professional and personal network to get a foot in the door and accelerate sales cycles.
* Happy with building prospecting lists and working closely with our Head of North East & Central Europe and CCO to define and execute a playbook that delivers new business within agreed timescales for your territory plan.
* Pitch Brite’s product portfolio (Instant Payments, Instant Payouts, Data Solutions), tailoring it to your prospects needs and being able to explain how our solutions are differentiated from our competitors.
* Use our CRM tool (Salesforce) to accurately input data, track and manage your opportunities daily.
* Deliver exceptional buying experiences to your prospects, representing the challenger spirit of Brite through a high integrity & open availability approach.
* You are a communicator who can explain complex topics in an easily understandable way.


**A successful candidate will;**
* Demonstrate how to qualify the right prospects and focus their time for maximum impact i.e. discovery calls that fit our ICP leading to value selling.
* Explain how they can influence key stakeholders (from the economic buyer to champions).
* Show how they have executed an effective sales strategy in the past, supported by detailed examples.
* Speak about how they have successfully communicated technical payment solutions to prospects in the past leading to a won opportunity.
* Exhibit how they have worked a sales cycle from first contact to live.


**What We Offer**
* Become part of Europe’s hottest Fintech, founded and led by some of the best in the industry that raised the largest Series A ($60 Mn) in Europe last year.
* This is your chance to leave your mark, enjoying the journey whilst working alongside experienced industry leaders who have done it before and want to do it again.
* An optimistic, empathetic, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself. We believe in continuous learning and knowledge exchange.
* Gain exposure to a wide range of verticals and use cases for Instant A2A Payments, meaning you will work with the most exciting, fast growth businesses in the Baltics.
* An annual wellbeing and professional development allowance. We promote our people to invest in themselves and unlock their full potential through courses, personal coaching.

title: Upphandlare
description:
*Är du en erfaren upphandlare med intresse för verksamhetsutveckling? Vill du vara med och bidra till en säker och tillgänglig kommunikation för Sverige? Inköps- och upphandlingsenheten på PTS står inför en spännande utvecklingsresa med fokus på expansion och förändring. Vill du vara med och växa med oss?* 




  





**Vi jobbar med det alla tar för givet. Att kunna kommunicera. Hos oss får du se till att det fungerar nu och i framtiden. För alla.** 




  





 Inköp- och upphandlingsenheten, som är en av fyra enheter inom ekonomiavdelningen på PTS, leder, samordnar och utvecklar PTS inköps- och upphandlingsverksamhet. Enheten ansvarar för myndighetens beredning av inköps- och upphandlingsärenden och i uppdraget ingår också att genomföra olika inköp och upphandlingar, möjliggöra effektiva inköp, förvalta avtal samt biträda myndigheten med kvalificerad rådgivning i frågor som rör upphandling, inköp och avtal.
 



  





 ”
 *Jag som kommer att vara din chef heter Gustav Blomberg. Jag har en gedigen bakgrund inom upphandling och brinner för att skapa en stark teamkänsla där vi hjälps åt för att nå våra gemensamma mål.* 
 ”
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som upphandlare kommer du bl.a. att ansvara för kritiska upphandlingsprojekt som genomförs i nära samarbete med verksamheten. Du behöver kunna leda en upphandlingsprocess från start till mål, samt ha en förmåga att sätta dig in i och realisera verksamhetens behov. Upphandlingsföremålen som kan komma att bli aktuella kan vara alltifrån olika typer av IT-system till mer verksamhetsspecifika köp med en tydlig koppling till PTS uppdrag. Det kan vidare bli aktuellt med de mera komplexa förfarandena, såsom förhandlat förfarande med föregående annons samt konkurrenspräglad dialog.
 



  





 Förstudie och annat upphandlingsstrategiskt arbete ingår som regel alltid inom ramen för våra projekt, men dimensioneras naturligtvis i relation till projektets komplexitet. Du kommer arbeta tillsammans med övriga medarbetare på upphandlingsenheten inom ramen för vissa av de större upphandlingsprojekten, som i regel involverar minst två upphandlare. Du kommer även ingå i vårt gemensamma verksamhetsutvecklingsarbete på upphandlingsenheten som syftar till att bl.a. utveckla våra arbetsprocesser och strukturkapital.
 



  





 På sikt ser vi även att vi kommer arbeta mer med frågor kopplat till uppföljning och avtalsförvaltning. Vi undersöker även möjligheten att utvecklas inom kategoristyrning och e-handel. Vi ser gärna att du har förmåga, kompetens och vilja att bidra inom ramen för även detta arbete.
 



  





**Om teamet** 




 Du igår i ett tight team om sex medarbetare och en upphandlingschef. Hälften av oss är utbildade jurister och vi hanterar själva upphandlingsrättsliga frågeställningar såsom överprövningar och rättsutredningar m.m. Enheten präglas av ett nära samarbete, både inom enheten och med den verksamhet vi ska stötta, vår strävan är att göra goda affärer.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 För att lyckas i rollen som upphandlare har du förmågan att samarbeta med verksamheten, ledningen och andra intressenter inom upphandlingsprojekt. Du trivs med att arbeta nära juridiska och tekniska experter för att säkerställa högkvalitativa resultat och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap för att stärka teamet. Du är lösningsorienterad och har en god förmåga att prioritera och snabbt hitta lösningar på problem som kan uppstå. Samtidigt är du resultatorienterad och sätter höga mål för dig själv, arbetar ambitiöst och gör vad som krävs för att uppnå bästa möjliga resultat.
 



  





 Som en viktig del av rollen är du också kommunikativ och uttrycker dig tydligt och välformulerat i både tal och skrift. Du säkerställer att ditt budskap når fram och anpassar din kommunikation efter mottagare och situation, för att skapa ett effektivt och konstruktivt samarbete. För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga, därför kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dessa.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* minst sex års erfarenhet som upphandlare, strategisk inköpare, upphandlingsjurist eller liknade roll.
* erfarenhet av att självständigt genomföra upphandlingar (minst sex stycken över tröskelvärdet under de senaste sex åren) inom ramen för upphandlingsregelverket.
* relevant akademisk examen inom tex juridik, civilekonom, civilingenjör eller YH-utbildning.



  





 Det är även meriterande om du har:
 


* erfarenhet av att ha genomfört förhandlat förfarande med föregående annonsering.
* erfarenhet av att ha genomfört konkurrenspräglad dialog.
* erfarenhet av att utforma utvärderingsmodeller som syftar till att säkerställa att upphandlingsföremålet har hög kvalitet.
* erfarenhet av att upphandla IT-lösningar.
* erfarenhet av att genomföra avrop från nationella ramavtal.
* erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med uppföljning.



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Vi tar livet på allvar. Hos oss kan du ha ett liv på och utanför jobbet. Mår du bra, mår vi bra. Därför erbjuder vi konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete. Vi har även generöst friskvårdsbidrag och två friskvårdstimmar varje vecka.
 



  





 Dessutom får du förmånliga villkor för lunch, semester, föräldraledighet, pension och vid sjukdom. Här kommer du arbeta i moderna aktivitetsbaserade lokaler på Hälsingegatan 38. Som statlig myndighet erbjuder vi en trygg och stabil arbetsmiljö där du kan känna dig säker. Vi skapar morgondagens samhälle och måste ligga i framkant. Hos oss kommer du att växa med uppgifter hela tiden.
 



  





**Bra att veta** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om sex månader. Placering i Stockholm med start snarast möjligt enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





 För att vi ska kunna göra en rättvis och objektiv bedömning av din kompetens ber vi dig att inte inkludera bild, personnummer eller adress i ditt CV. Tester kommer att ingå i processen. Om du har skyddade uppgifter, vänligen kontakta vår HR-specialist.
 



  





 För ytterligare information, vänligen kontakta enhetschef Gustav Blomberg på gustav.blomberg@pts.se eller HR-specialist Jessica Petersson på jessica.petersson@pts.se. För frågor relaterade till vår lokala fackliga arbetstagarorganisation, vänligen maila till saco@pts.se.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 20 januari.** 




  





**Vi driver och försvarar allas rätt till säker och tillgänglig** 
**kommunikation. Varje dag, varje sekund. I hela Sverige.**

title: Account Executive SMB
description:
**Description**
 What We’re Looking For:
   

  

 Excited about the prospect of stepping into the
 **Account Executive SMB** 
 role with us at Meltwater? We're on the lookout for individuals like yourself to join our dynamic team and drive the initiation of new business ventures. As an
 **Account Executive SMB** 
 , your pivotal role lies in securing new business within our small to medium market segment. You will learn a deep understanding of Meltwater's value proposition and will navigate through all phases of the sales cycle.
   

  

 At Meltwater, it's not just about your position—it's an invitation to explore personal and professional growth opportunities. Immerse yourself in an environment that fosters skill development, encourages mentorship, and champions inclusive leadership. Collaborate closely with experienced professionals and inspirational leaders who are dedicated to supporting you every step of the way.
   

  

 Join our community, and you'll find a culture that celebrates your uniqueness and empowers you to unlock your full potential. Let's embark on this collective journey and redefine how we approach driving new business at Meltwater!
   

  

 What You'll Do:
   

  

* Embrace the role of a 360 seller within the dynamic SMB landscape, proactively identifying and targeting potential new Meltwater customers
* Meet or exceed quarterly sales quotas by effectively identifying and targeting potential new Meltwater customers.
* Utilize thorough discovery processes to qualify leads and prioritize efforts towards high-value opportunities.
* Consistently deliver engaging demonstrations and persuasive sales presentations, to captivate audiences and convert leads into customers.
* Proactively manage contract negotiations to secure agreements that meet both customer requirements and company objectives.
* Collaborate closely with internal teams such as Customer Success and Sales Operations to guarantee a seamless process for our clients.
* Regularly assess progress towards quarterly goals and adjust strategies as needed to maintain momentum and achieve targets.


 What You'll Bring:
   

  

* A Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred for this role, allowing you to leverage your academic strengths.
* A minimum of 1 year of experience in business-to-business sales is required, with a demonstrated success in new business development.
* Proficiency in negotiation tactics is essential, coupled with the ability to articulate intricate value propositions persuasively.
* Proven track record of being results-driven, consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Proactive approach towards executing targeted outreach initiatives and generating leads.
* Strong organizational prowess, including adept management of the customer purchase process and skillful negotiation of contract terms.
* Collaborative mindset, with the ability to effectively coordinate efforts with internal teams to ensure successful implementation.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Willingness to embrace the best of both worlds with our hybrid work schedule. This role requires you to be in the office 3 days a week
* The ability to legally work in the country of hire is required for this position.


****What We Offer:****
* Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive PlanSjuk Silver and PlanLov, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


**Where You'll Work: Brahegatan 10 7tr, 114 37 Stockholm, Sweden**
 When You'll Join: ASAP
   

  

 Our Story
   

  

 The sky is the limit at Meltwater.
   

  

 At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.
   

  

 Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do – from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products — and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.
   

  

 We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.
   

  

 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
   

  

 Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.
   

  

 All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.
   

  

 Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.

title: Payment Platform Owner
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill leda utvecklingen i branschen genom att driva förändring och arbetar aktivt för att minska vårt eget klimatavtryck, såväl som att hjälpa våra kunder att göra bättre och mer hållbara val utifrån sina förutsättningar. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Nu söker vi på OKQ8 en ny Payment Platform Owner.
   

  

 I rollen ansvarar du för att designa och utveckla moderna betalningslösningar inom e-handel och POS-terminaler som stöder kundens affärsstrategier.
   

  

 Fokusområden inkluderar integration av betalningssystem, molnbaserade betalningsplattformar, drift, fraud, analys genom omni-kanal och säkerställande av efterlevnad av regulatoriska krav som DORA, NIS2 och PCI DSS. Du kommer att vara en nyckelspelare i att bygga framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur. Du kommer arbeta och ansvara genom hela betalcykeln som Merchant, Acquirer, Issuer, Card schemes och Open Banking. Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, systemutveckling eller ekonomi.
* 5–10 års erfarenhet av att designa och implementera betalningslösningar, gärna i en multikanalsmiljö.
* Stark teknisk kompetens inom områden som betalningsgateways, molnarkitektur och API-integrationer.
* Erfarenhet att jobba med leverantörer, uppföljning och budgetansvar.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med regulatoriska standarder och säkerhet inom betalningslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda komplexa projekt och samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team.


 Som person är du strategisk, lösningsorienterad och har en stark analytisk förmåga. Du trivs med att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö och drivs av att utveckla lösningar som skapar värde för både kunder och verksamhet.
   

  

 OKQ8 Scandinavia arbetar för att vara en jämställd arbetsplats med medarbetare som trivs och utvecklas och där olikheter uppmuntras. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som hjälper till att minska utanförskap och bidrar till mångfald.
   

  

 I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.
   

  

 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: Senior Digital Marketing Consultant - CRM/Personalisation
company_industry: Advertising Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
NoA Connect is part of The North Alliance – one of Scandinavia’s largest agency networks in design, media, and marketing. NoA Connect has three business areas: Advisory services, Performance marketing, and Data & Analytics. This role is a senior position within Advisory, where we work integrated with our clients as consultants to drive marketing efficiency and transformation.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Senior personalization and CRM expert, you will work to increase our clients' use of data- and marketing technologies. Effectively helping them to achieve their business objectives by smarter data collection and utilization strategies.
 



 You will review existing setup and processes, plan, present, and implement solutions for optimized CRM performance suited to cross-functional teams at companies of various sizes.
 



 Common tasks include current state assessments, suggested CRM/MA strategies for optimized system usage and user experience, business case formulation, and creating roadmaps to reach the desired state. As well as hands-on daily operations in the clients' CRM/MA platform/s. We strongly believe in being an integrated part of the client’s team and daily operations for maximized impact.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Lead end-to-end personalization projects, from strategy and planning to execution and optimization.
* Work hands-on in marketing automation tools (e.g., Salesforce, Adobe, Braze) to implement customer journeys.
* Test, measure, and analyse the effectiveness of the communication and identify improvements.
* Develop and execute personalized marketing strategies using Customer Data Platforms (CDPs), marketing automation tools, CRM, and other relevant technologies.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams including marketing, sales, IT, and data analytics to align customer lifecycle management initiatives with business objectives.
* Serve as a technical expert and advisor to clients, guiding them on best practices in personalization, automation, and data integrations.
* Together with content managers, develop content assets across email, push, SMS, and landing pages.



  





**We believe that you have:** 



* 5+ years of experience in CRM, customer lifecycle management, personalization, or related fields, with a proven track record of success.
* Employee experience from a B2B or B2C company.
* Proven business results of your CRM/personalisation initiatives.
* Expertise in Customer Data Platforms (CDPs), marketing automation tools, CRM systems, and IT architecture.
* Strong technical knowledge with hands-on experience in platforms such as Salesforce, Braze, Adobe, Hubspot or similar.
* Proven project management skills, with the ability to manage cross-functional teams and deliver on-time, on-budget projects.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate technical solutions into business terms for non-technical stakeholders, and vice versa.



  





**What we offer** 




 We have an exciting future planned for NoA Connect and strive to develop our brand together with our colleagues and the rest of the NoA-family. Our client list covers a broad variety of industries including fashion & beauty retail, telecom, food, communication, and banking. Examples of customers are SAS, Telia, Strawberry, Länsförsäkringar, Adidas and ACO.
 


* The opportunity to develop your know-how, discuss customer needs, trends, and share knowledge with colleagues.
* The possibility to combine working from home, the office and at client’s offices.
* Respect for the personal situation and a healthy work/life balance
* Great benefits such as pension contribution, wellness allowance and 30 days of paid vacation.
* A platform for individual growth through collaboration across our agency network with cutting edge leading expertise across the entire eco-system of data, technology and creativity.
* ... and much more.



  





**Our recruitment process** 




 No need for a personal letter or a CV-document. Just provide a link to your LinkedIn profile and answer a few initial questions - that's it. If you move forward to the next stage, we will use recruitment tests to ensure a fair selection based on your readiness for the role and your potential to grow with us.
 



 To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. Therefore, as part of our recruitment process, we use Alva Labs assessments to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role.
 



  





**About NoA Connect** 




 We are digital marketing experts that drive customer acquisition and activation with marketing technology, data and strategic advice.
 


* Our vision: A world free from marketing waste.
* Our values: We put people first. We never stop exploring. We make a mark.
* Offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo and Helsinki.
* 130 colleagues in total and 60 colleagues in Stockholm.

title: Citrix Specialist
description:
Har du gedigen erfarenhet av Citrixmiljöer och trivs i en lösningsorienterad arbetsmiljö där teknisk innovation står i fokus? Vill du bidra till samhällssäkerhet genom att utveckla och förvalta IT-miljöer i en komplex organisation? Då kan den här möjligheten vara rätt för dig!
 



 Vår kund söker nu en Citrix Specialist för att förstärka sitt IT- och teknikteam. I den här rollen kommer du att vara en viktig del av ett dynamiskt team som arbetar nära verksamheten för att säkerställa att organisationens Citrixmiljöer utvecklas, förvaltas och optimeras på bästa sätt.
 


 Om rollen
 
 I rollen som Citrix Specialist kommer du att arbeta med både förvaltning och vidareutveckling av
 **Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktop (CVAD)-miljöer** 
 i en modern IT-miljö där säkerhet är en prioritet. Du kommer att arbeta med allt från arkitektur och implementation till drift och felsökning av Citrixlösningar, inklusive integration med den omgivande Microsoft-miljön.
   





 Som Citrix Specialist kommer du att:
 


* Ansvara för
 **arkitektur, implementation, drift och felsökning** 
 av CVAD-miljöer.
* Hantera operativsystem såsom
 **Windows Server & Desktop samt Linux** 
 .
* Arbeta med
 **Netscaler ADC** 
 och applikationshantering (MSI, MSIX, APP-V).
* Bidra till säkerhetshöjande åtgärder och dokumentation av system och applikationer.
* Implementera och förvalta
 **lagringslösningar** 
 (NAS, SAN, iSCSI) samt arbeta med tunna klienter.
* Arbeta med 
 **automatisering och skriptning** 
 (t.ex. PowerShell).


 Kravprofil
 * Du har en
 **universitets- eller högskoleexamen** 
 inom datavetenskap eller liknande område, alternativt har du förvärvat motsvarande kunskaper genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Du har gedigen erfarenhet av
 **arkitektur och implementation av Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktop (CVAD)-miljöer** 
 , inklusive tillhörande komponenter.
* Efarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur såsom
 **Active Directory, GPO, nätverk, lagringslösningar och smartkort-autentisering** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av Netscaler ADC för CVAD-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med
 **georedundanta lösningar** 
 för CVAD-miljöer.
* Kunskaper inom olika
 **hypervisors** 
 som
 **VMware ESX, Citrix XenServer, Nutanix AHV** 
 eller
 **Microsoft Hyper-V** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av arbete med
 **nätverk** 
 , inklusive brandväggar, routing och switching.
* Färdigheter inom
 **automatisering** 
 och
 **skriptning** 
 med
 **PowerShell** 
 .
* Du behärskar
 **svenska och engelska** 
  flytande i tal och skrift och har goda kunskaper i engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.



**Som person** 
 ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och analytisk, med förmågan att identifiera och åtgärda komplexa problem på ett effektivt sätt. Du är prestigelös och trivs med att samarbeta nära kollegor för att nå gemensamma mål. Med ett stort ansvarstagande förstår du vikten av säkerhet i IT-miljöer och har en naturlig fallenhet för att arbeta i säkerhetskritiska sammanhang där noggrannhet och integritet är avgörande.
   

  





**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Cloud Solutions Engineer - Castra
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
**Rollen**
 Du kommer att bli en nyckelspelare i vår Cloud-gruppering och bidra med expertis till våra kunder inom Cloud och digital transformation.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* Implementera, konfigurera och supportera Cloud-lösningar.
* Driva kontinuerlig förbättring och automatisering genom CI/CD-processer.
* Arbeta med design, implementation, transformation, drift, support och optimering av molnmiljöer.


 Som expert kommer du att ge rådgivning som optimerar kundernas användarupplevelse, prestanda och kostnader för utveckling, drift och systemförvaltning. Notera att detta är en teknisk och operativ roll där du arbetar praktiskt med implementation och optimering av molnlösningar.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av en eller flera molnplattformar: AWS, Microsoft Azure eller Google Cloud.
* Djupa kunskaper inom Microsoft Server och/eller Linux (t.ex. Red Hat).
* Erfarenhet av att automatisera processer inom Cloud Operations, inklusive scriptning.
* Kompetens inom Storage, nätverk, säkerhet och virtualisering.
* Färdigheter i ett eller flera programmeringsspråk.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt och i team.


 Vi söker dig som brinner för att hitta effektiva lösningar och ständigt vill förbättra både teknik och processer.
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@Castra.se alt. 0728716312

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 We are looking to strengthen our Platform Services team with a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer who is passionate about building secure, scalable and reliable systems. If you're skilled in Cloud platforms, automation, and infrastructure as code, we'd love to talk with you.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Your way to impact**
* You will be joining our mission to enable our product teams by providing a reliable, observable and scalable platform.
* Continuously innovate and deliver awesome experiences for our internal customers – the development teams.
* Prove your problem-solving skills in both day-to-day work as well as during lab days and hack weeks.
* Work with your peers in the Cloud Infrastructure chapter, collaborating on platform improvements, increasing learning opportunities, and creating opportunities for growth in a supportive environment.


**Your day-to-day**
 In your day-to-day role, you will develop and maintain tools to support product teams in building and delivering solutions quickly and reliably. Additionally, you will design, set up, and codify best practices and processes to manage infrastructure and resources.
   

  

**You will get the opportunity to:**
* Drive architectural decisions and ensure that the system architecture satisfies the needs of all the stakeholders and key system quality attributes.
* Govern the infrastructure, resources and accounts in AWS
* Ensure that Compliance and Security standards are adhered to.
* Actively contribute and demonstrate healthy modern engineering practices.
* Drive projects and implementations within our team’s areas of responsibility.
* Participate in the on-call rotation for the team to ensure 24/7 availability of our services.


**What do you need to bring?**
* Advanced knowledge of Linux and Networking.
* Experienced in AWS Cloud.
* Are versed in container orchestration (Kubernetes or ECS).
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, Cloud formation, and AWS CDK.
* A solid expertise in CI/CD systems. We primarily use GitHub Actions and CircleCI.
* Programming background (preferably Python, Golang or Bash).
* Conforming to best practices in Cybersecurity, e.g., IAM, WAF, and DDoS.
* Are familiar with distributed systems.


**Expertise in one or more of the following is a plus:**
* Experience with Java or Kotlin and related frameworks.
* Worked with PCI-DSS compliant infrastructures.
* Experience with observability tools such as Datadog, Splunk.


 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0120994

title: Windowstekniker access management
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vi söker nu flera nya medarbetare till teamet medsom består av utvecklare inom IAM - Identity Access Management. Saabs IT-avdelning, Group IT, växer stadigt och och söker nu ett flertal nya medarbetare för att fortsätta utvecklas. Dudu kommer bli en del av en dynamisk och innovativ arbetsplats där din medverkan bidrar till en viktig del i säker hantering av Saab's Identiteter. Du kommer att arbeta i vårt IAM-team och med agila arbetssätt leverera värde till Saabs Business Areas.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter består bland annat av att:
   

  

* Utveckla och drifta IAM-verktyget Identity Manager från One Identity
* Hantera frågor och olika typer av ärenden i vårt ärendesystem
* Samarbeta med övriga tekniska team för att tillsammans leverera hög-kvalitativa lösningar
* Utveckla och underhålla vår dokumentation
* Leverera stöd till kollegor, i och utanför teamet


 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker passionerade och kunniga medarbetare i rollen för att stärka vårt team och ta vår Identitetsplattform till nya höjder. Som person är du intresserad av att utvecklas och lära dig, du är engagerad och tycker om att arbeta mot mål och fokusera på resultat.
   

  

 Våra krav är att du har goda kunskaper inom:
   

  

* Windows Infrastruktur
* Powershell
* Relationsdatabaser / T-SQL
* Katalogtjänster såsom Active Directory


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* LDAP / SAML / OAuth / OIDC
* Single Sign-On
* PAM
* Federation
* Azure


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men vi är en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Har du erfarenhet inom nätverk och infrastruktur och är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Hos Amendo Tech får du möjligheten att arbeta med ledande företag inom bank, finans, retail, myndigheter, produktbolag och innovativa startups. Vi söker just nu engagerade konsulter för kommande interimsuppdrag som kan stärka våra kunders tekniska landskap och säkerställa deras infrastruktur och nätverk på högsta nivå.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kunnig inom nätverksarkitektur och säkerhet och som har erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och övervaka nätverkslösningar i komplexa miljöer. Du har arbetat med några av följande tekniker:
   

  

* Nätverksprotokoll och teknik: Stark kompetens inom TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLAN, VPN och routingprotokoll (t.ex. OSPF, BGP).
* Brandväggar och säkerhet: Erfarenhet av brandväggar, IDS/IPS, och andra säkerhetslösningar, exempelvis Cisco ASA, Palo Alto eller Fortinet.
* Trådlösa nätverk: Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och hantera trådlösa nätverk (WLAN) och Wi-Fi-lösningar.
* Lastbalansering och redundans: Kunskap om lastbalanserare och failover-lösningar för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet.
* Nätverksövervakning och felsökning: Vana vid att använda övervakningsverktyg.
* Certifieringar: Gärna certifieringar inom Cisco (t.ex. CCNA, CCNP) eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Molnplattformar: Gedigen erfarenhet av AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud Platform samt arbete med hybridmoln-arkitektur.
* Virtuella miljöer: Erfarenhet av virtualiseringsteknologier som VMware, Hyper-V eller KVM.
* Serveradministration: Kompetens inom Windows- och Linux-servrar, inklusive säkerhetspatchning och hantering av Active Directory.
* Lagring och backup: Kunskap om SAN, NAS och backuplösningar som Veeam eller Commvault.
* Automatisering och scripting: Förmåga att effektivisera och automatisera arbetsflöden med hjälp av PowerShell, Python eller Ansible.
* Säkerhet och övervakning: Förståelse för säkerhetspraxis och vana vid övervakningsverktyg för driftssäkerhet, exempelvis Zabbix eller Splunk.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Technical Product Manager - Shared Components (Real Time Communication)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Product Manager to own and drive the roadmap and requirements for critical shared components within our Real Time Communication product suite. You will be the key link between engineering, product and product operation stakeholders, ensuring alignment and successful delivery of impactful solutions.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our Real-Time Communication team is building the future of real time communication for enterprises! We're passionate about creating seamless and engaging experiences across a suite of products that connect people worldwide. This includes programmable voice, in-app calling, verification, number lookup and fax solutions. All of these products generate billions of events every year that results in insightful and business critical data both for us at Sinch and for our customers. As we continue to grow and innovate, we need a talented Technical Product Manager to lead the charge of our platform team, Shared Components.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define and implement a strategy for collecting, analysing, and leveraging AI and usage data across all RTCx products.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our common financial and business intelligence pipelines.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our configuration tool used for operating all RTCx products.
* Work closely with product managers across different RTCx products and Sinch to ensure seamless integration and consistent data model and standard.
* Provide technical guidance and support to the engineering team, contributing to architectural decisions and technology choices.


**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Technical Product Manager with a focus on backend systems, data platforms or API based products.
* Experience of defining and detailing requirements.
* Strong knowledge of data flows, billing, account management, and configuration tools in large-scale systems.
* Proven track record of managing complex, cross-functional projects with a focus on scaling and reliability.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders.
* Technical background or experience with backend development, data infrastructure and analytics is highly preferred.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deep dive into the technical details and complexity.
* Familiarity with data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR) and AI.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Engineer
description:
This is a general track for Senior Engineer or above in any team at Canonical. After the first round of interviews we will establish which teams might be an excellent fit, and progress your application with them.
   

  

 Canonical delivers open source to the world across every class of compute. Canonical Ubuntu is the world's favourite Linux for cloud, desktop and IoT. Our engineering teams work on operating systems, programming languages, applications, devices, infrastructure and services. We work in Golang, Python, C, C++, and Rust for system services, and use React and Flutter on the front end.
   

  

 In our levelling framework, a Senior Engineer is not only an outstanding software architect and coder, they also demonstrate the leadership qualities needed to rally a team to ship outstanding products. A Senior Engineer partners with an Engineering Manager, who is also code-capable, and together they take responsibility for team outcomes. We hire based on academic results and proven product execution, and we select those with a passion for open-source software, innovation, and cutting-edge technology. In this role, you will make a significant contribution in Canonical's portfolio through high-quality code, technical leadership, team motivation and direction, exceptional design, and crisp documentation.
   

  

 As a Senior Engineer you'll drive the architecture, design and evolution of high-impact open source. Our teams work at every level of the stack. From the kernel and system software at the core of Ubuntu through to major language runtimes and the bleeding-edge of cloud automation and distributed systems, you'll have the opportunity to work on complex but highly rewarding projects. Our teams also build the services which deliver Ubuntu to the world, on cloud, devices, servers and PCs.
   

  

 Additionally, this role will give you the opportunity to engage with the broader open-source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and ensure seamless software operations at scale.
   

  

 Location: we have remote opportunities for Senior Engineers in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead design and architecture of an impactful open source project
* Code in Golang, Rust, Python, C/C++ or Typescript / React
* Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
* Mentor, develop and advise colleagues in their career progression
* Display technical leadership in Canonical and our communities
* Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation with the aim to make it the best of its kind
* Work from home with global travel twice annually for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Technical leadership as well as team motivation, direction and pace
* Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Deep experience with at least one of Go, Rust, Python or C
* Subject matter expertise in your engineering domain
* Conscientiousness and detail orientation, with a focus on performance
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with container technologies such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience with highly concurrent, distributed systems
* Experience with embedded systems
* Performance engineering – from kernel to web – benchmarks, optimisation
* Experience with software security – fuzzing, tabletop threat models, analysis, audit
* Experience build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services
* Deep quality and test engineering
* Web or Flutter front-end experience
* REST and gRPC API experience
* SQL and NoSQL data store expertise
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit globally and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Sustainability Platform Internship
description:
Are you a student with a passion for using your technical skills to create a more sustainable future? We're excited to offer an internship program at Position Green for tech students who want to help companies accelerate their sustainability agenda and make a lasting impact!
   

  

**About Us**
 Position Green is a leading sustainability partner with a mission to revolutionize how businesses integrate sustainability. Through our rapidly growing SaaS platform, strategic advisory, and e-learning services, Position Green’s offering makes sustainability actionable and measurable, supporting businesses to fast-track their sustainability transformation while also strengthening their competitiveness and long-term survival. Our significant growth means we're operating in a fast-paced environment, driving impactful change in sustainability for businesses worldwide.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an intern, you will work in either our
 **Customer Success Team** 
 or
 **Product Team** 
 , contributing to our mission of supporting businesses in their sustainability journey.
   

  

* Customer Success Team (Platform Analyst): You will support our Customer Success team by developing measure structures in the Position Green Platform that accurately meet customers' needs. You will learn about various sustainability standards, dive deep into our platform and its functionalities, support different customer projects, and participate in customer meetings in an analyst role. You will always work alongside a Platform Manager who takes on project leadership.
* Product Team (Solution Analyst): You will integrate, optimize, and solve for important sustainability standards in the reporting landscape, helping customers achieve compliance. You'll participate in the full lifecycle of solution building—ideating, testing, maintaining, and improving the templates and visualizations we use for hundreds of customers. You will be collaborating closely with Product Managers and learning about product development and what it is like to work in the product department.


**In both roles, you will:**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
* Develop a deep understanding of our platform's features, helping clients apply them effectively.
* Collaborate with experienced team members and share knowledge while building skills in product development, programming, and sustainability.
* Work with small teams to create impactful solutions in a continuous learning environment, with opportunities to shadow senior team members.
* Additionally, you may have the opportunity to contribute to internal projects, help develop our processes, and support different areas of the organization.


**Are You the One We Are Looking For?**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you are currently studying Engineering or Computer Science.
   

  

 You are meticulous and have a technical understanding, as well as a strong interest in working with digital products. You’re fluent in English, both written and spoken.
   

  

 As a person, you have a positive attitude, are eager to learn, and enjoy collaborating with others to bring positive change. A sense of curiosity, humor, a sharp eye for details and strong problem-solving skills are also important to us.
   

  

**What’s Next?**
 If this opportunity excites you, please submit your CV. We value personal suitability highly in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We're reviewing applications as they come in, so don't wait too long to reach out! If everything aligns, we're hoping to welcome our new team member by December 2024 to June 2025, based in Malmö or Stockholm. Since this is a full-time internship requiring office work during regular hours, we expect candidates to take a study break during this period.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 To be eligible for an internship with us, you need to be currently enrolled in university studies.
   

  

**The recruitment process consists of:**
 First interview (Digital withPeople & Culture Team)
   

  

 Business case interview (Digital with Team Lead + Team member)
   

  

 Third Interview (Team Lead)
   

  

 Decision & Reference check
   

  

*To ensure a fair and unbiased process, we kindly request that you refrain from attaching a cover letter to your application. We look forward to hearing from you!*
* Position Green is the Nordic leader in sustainability software and ESG consulting.
* Supports 700+ customers worldwide.
* 350+ employees with expertise within strategy, software development, environmental studies, engineering, communication and social sciences.
* Awarded and recognized as one of the leading tech scaleups in the Nordics by Techarenan, Deloitte, Norrsken Impact Summit, Cleantech Scandinavia and Breakit.

title: Senior Back-End Engineer • Identity
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionise commerce, we are on the lookout for a talented Back-End Engineer to join one of our teams at the forefront of shaping innovative solutions and crafting modern products that positively impact our merchants' lives. If this intro sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
 PayPal in Sweden originated from Zettle, focusing on commerce services targeting small and medium businesses, and we are now expanding to contribute to the wider PayPal portfolio.
   

  

**Meet our team**
 In this role, you'll join our PayPal Engineering Team responsible for designing, building, deploying, and maintaining back-end Java services. You will collaborate closely with a diverse group of talented individuals from engineering, product, and design to create solutions that power PayPal's customer experiences.
   

  

 With a strong focus on security, you will take care of many aspects of our merchants lifecycle, from their initial onboarding, to ensuring a smooth and secure experience while accessing the different products of the PayPal ecosystem. You will become part of a great group of talented and supportive engineers with a strong focus in collaboration not just between the team, but between many different teams in the organization.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 Joining us means partnering with Product and Design counterparts who share a commitment to enhancing our merchants' daily experiences. Here, you will have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Continuously innovate and deliver awesome experiences for our users. Solve real customer problems through technology.
* Demonstrate and sharpen your problem-solving skills in both day-to-day work as well as during lab days and hack weeks.
* Co-elaborate with your peers across our Backend Engineering chapter, working on platform improvements and increasing learning opportunities for and creating opportunities for growth in a supportive environment.


**Your day to day**
* Develop clean, maintainable, high-quality Java code.
* Take ownership of the delivery – your own, and your peer engineers in the team.
* Design, build, deploy, and maintain services powering PayPal's customer experiences.
* Collaborate with other skilled and motivated engineers on the team as well as product and design to deliver a world-class experience.
* Continuously raise the bar on the quality and customer focus in the products we develop.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Proven / Practical experience of developing back-end services in Java.
* Focus on delivery, attention to detail and quality of the end result.
* Practical experience designing, building and maintaining distributed systems in a cloud-native environment.
* Experience working in an agile development team, using common tools like Jira and GitHub.
* Interest not only on growing yourself, but helping other team members to grow, encouraging a continuous and constructive feedback culture.
* Experience in cloud infrastructure (we primarily use AWS).


**Get bonus points if you also bring...**
* Experience working with user authorization standards (OAuth 2.0).
* Experience working with Node.js.


 Curious to know more? Great! Don’t hesitate to
 **apply** 
 and / or
 **let's chat!**
 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0113430

title: Business Control Intern
description:
At Sandvik Mining and Rock Solutions, we’re now looking for a student with strong business interest and a tech-savvy approach – someone who wants to engage in business finance at one of Sweden’s largest and most exciting industrial companies. We're all about the dream crew, crushing goals, and creating fresh, innovative ways to get things done – welcome to our brilliant team!
   

  

**More About Us And The Team**
 We provide cutting-edge solutions for our mining and construction customers, and within our Business Control team, we support our divisions by offering efficient, reliable, and proactive financial and business analysis to our key stakeholders. We aim to be the best possible business partner, and we want you to join us!
   

  

**What You Do**
 In this position, you support our team and the management of our business with a wide variety of tasks. You’re connected to our strong finance network spanning over nine divisions and 14 sales areas – a great opportunity to learn from a lot of talented finance individuals at Sandvik. In this role you support us with both recurring tasks in book closings, forecasts and development projects as well as ad-hoc requests.
   

  

 You’re exposed to and learn:
   

  

* Performance management structures in a true global industrial company.
* How to work with consolidation and business intelligence systems.
* Turn data into information and valuable insights.


 The location for this position is at the World Trade Center in Stockholm.
   

  

**Who You Are And What We Expect From You**
 We believe you’re at the end of either your bachelor’s or master’s degree, within the field of finance, business or accounting. However, in the end it is about the right attitude and personality. You thrive when being challenged, and you enjoy trying new things and long to put your academic experience and knowledge at the test. You have excellent skills in Excel, and you love creating good looking Power Point slides. You’re not afraid to try out new IT tools. Acting in a global environment calls for fluency in both verbal and written English.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Adam Lagerström, Director of Business Control, +46 (0)70-340 46 21 or adam.lagerstrom@sandvik.com
   

  

 We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We have an ongoing process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than February 23rd, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0074387.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site.

title: Supply Chain Summer Internship 2025
description:
**Job Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you ready to gain real work experience with one of the world’s largest Consumer Goods Company also recognized as an industry leader in supply chain?
   

  

 If so, our Supply Chain Summer Internship is the perfect opportunity for you! This is a unique opportunity to join a highly collaborative team driving supply chain innovation at P&G while still at university, setting the path for your future career.
   

  

 From start to finish, you can count on our people in Supply Network Operations to get the job done – and to do it better than anyone in the industry. Beginning with overseeing our materials all the way to placing our brands in the hands of shoppers, you’ll play your part as an expert integrator for supply across our many operations. It’s a big job to move some of the most-loved brands around the world, but by leveraging cutting-edge technologies, you’ll lead the efforts and innovate along the way.
   

  

**What To Expect**
 During your 10-week summer internship you will get a first-hand experience of what a career in Supply Network with P&G is like, and if it is right for you. It is designed to give students an intensive immersion in the exciting and challenging environment we work in. You will be entrusted with real, individual technical and business projects to lead, own, and execute over the course of your time with us. If you are looking for an exciting and challenging experience, have a passion for winning, strong leadership credentials – this internship is for you.
   

  

 This role is based at our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 and we look to offer internships to our top candidates by end of January!
   

  

**What You Will Gain**
* Responsibilities and Real Work from Day 1: You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger.
* Continuous training & coaching: You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
* Dynamic and respectful work environment: Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting flexible working arrangements and work/life balance.
* Compensation & Benefits A job with P&G offers a competitive salary as well as other great benefits such as a great pension and share schemes. To find more information about our benefits package take a look here
* Full-time Role: Successful interns have the potential to secure a full-time position with P&G after graduation. As a 'build from within' company, our people start at entry level and progress through the organization. When we make a job offer, it’s with the expectation that you will grow into one of our future leaders, and to help you get there, you will work closely with skilled P&G veterans for mentoring and coaching at every step.


**Job Qualifications**
**What We Look For:**
* University undergraduates who will have completed their degree by Summer 2026 or graduates who have completed a degree.
* Evidence of passion and achievements in academic and/or non-academic activities. Tell us what you’re proud of – be it playing a musical instrument or holding down a job alongside your studies. We want to get to know you!
* Demonstrated leadership skills and analytical capability.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong Swedish and English verbal and written skills to business proficiency
* Passionate about pursuing a career at P&G after graduation


**Start date:** 
 The internship's duration is from 9th June 2025 until 15th August 2025. We expect interns to be available for the full duration of the internship.
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
 15th January 2025 – Apply soon to secure your chance, as positions could be filled before the deadline. We may close early if all roles are filled.
   

  

**At P&G #weseeequal**
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
